column2: JOB TITLE : Manager Master Data ManagementBUSINESS: Piramal Pharma LimitedTRAVEL: Low DEPARTMENT: GBSSLOCATION: Mumbai SHIFT: GeneralJOB OVERVIEW:Through a phased approach, the Global Business Shared Services (GBSS) Center will deliver many of the F&A and Supply Chain services, besides Master Data Management (MDM). The Manager (and her team) in charge of Master Data Management (within GBSS) would be responsible for the entire Piramal Pharma solutions, Critical Care, and CPD business for both domestic and international sites. The primary responsibility of the MDM team would be to use a standardized process for creating, updating, reviewing (quality assurance) and archiving the Master Data records, to support global operations, processes and reporting needs.REPORTING STRUCTURE:General Manager  Supply Chain Operations and MDMQUALIFICATIONBachelors degree with MBA from a reputed University/Institute. Orientation course in SAP MM / SD module will be added advantageEXPERIENCE:??10 to 12 years of experience in in master data management or a related role with shared services/global business services, Supply Chain or operations and service delivery??Well versed with Vendor Master, Customer Master , Price Master, Material master set up in SAP ECC 6 / SAP HANASKILLS AND COMPETENCIES??Quick Learner and past experience in team management??Analytical mindset with a focus on problem-solving and continuous improvement.??Strong interpersonal skills and ability to influence others. Demonstrated ability to collaborate with various people and organizations in an effort to develop win/win results.??Demonstrated experience with data management practices, data governance concepts and data management tools.??Demonstrated proficiency using MS Office programs (Word, Excel, Power Point, Access, Visioetc.) KEY ROLES/RESPONSIBILITIES:The responsibilities and accountabilities of the position include but are not limited to thefollowing:??Responsible for managing the team of 4 associates which set up various master data such as Customer Master, Vendor Master, FG price Master, Material Master, BOM in SAP.??Check the input received from the end users / sites at MDM team. Identify missing information, duplicates, policy non-compliance??Ensure monthly SLA of the Master data team on timeliness and accuracy of the master datamaintenance??Publish monthly report on MDM team performance in various forums and lead thepresentations??Monthly reviews of the master data to address irregularities and correct the same postdiscussion with stakeholders??Monitor existing Robotics Process automations deployed in the process to ensure thatautomations are working at the required level of accuracy??Automate the master data process. Build additional controls / business rules in SAP to ensurethat the data is maintained as per the business requirement??Strive to continuously improve processes & systems to deliver the greatest business benefit  challenge the status quo demonstrating a continuous improvement mindset.??Share the best practices in Master Data Management space to improve the process??Maintain comprehensive documentation for master data processes and procedures.??Front face the Internal audit related to Master data management and ensure that the desired CEI index is maintained for the process??Manage the relationship with stakeholders involved in process to ensure that the internalcustomers are served well??Collaborate with other departments to streamline data-related workflows.??Collaborate with IT, finance, operations, & other departments to address data-related challenges and implement solutions.??Provide leadership and guidance to the Master Data Management Team??Foster a collaborative and high-performance team culture.??Provide ongoing training and development opportunities for team members.??Conduct regular team meetings and performance evaluations.??Identifies areas for data quality improvements and helps to resolve data quality problemsthrough the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and. column2: Job Title: Quality Assurance ManagerCompany Overview:Hab Pharmaceuticals and Research Ltd is a leading pharmaceutical company dedicated to delivering safe and effective healthcare solutions to patients worldwide. We prioritize quality and compliance in all aspects of our operations to ensure the highest standards of product safety and efficacy.Position Overview:We are seeking an experienced Quality Assurance Manager to oversee our quality assurance activities and ensure adherence to regulatory requirements and company standards. The Quality Assurance Manager will play a crucial role in maintaining our commitment to quality and continuous improvement.Responsibilities:Develop, implement, and maintain quality assurance policies, procedures, and systems to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, including FDA, cGMP, and other relevant standards.Lead and manage a team of quality assurance professionals, providing guidance, training, and support to ensure effective execution of quality assurance activities.Establish and maintain quality management systems, including document control, change control, deviation management, and CAPA (Corrective and Preventive Action) processes.Conduct internal audits to assess compliance with quality systems, identify areas for improvement, and ensure corrective actions are implemented in a timely manner.Coordinate and support external audits and inspections by regulatory agencies, customers, and other stakeholders, ensuring readiness and providing documentation and support as needed.Review and approve quality-related documents, including batch records, protocols, reports, and SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures), to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with regulatory requirements.Manage and investigate quality incidents, deviations, complaints, and non-conformances, leading root cause analysis and implementing corrective and preventive actions to prevent recurrence.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including manufacturing, quality control, regulatory affairs, and supply chain, to address quality issues, drive continuous improvement, and support new product development and commercialization.Stay informed about industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices in quality assurance, and provide guidance and recommendations for process improvements and risk mitigation strategies.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in pharmaceutical sciences, chemistry, biology, engineering, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.Minimum of 3-7 years of experience in quality assurance within the pharmaceutical industry, with a solid understanding of FDA regulations, cGMP guidelines, and other regulatory requirements.Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively manage a team and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders.Experience in developing and implementing quality management systems, conducting internal audits, and managing regulatory inspections.Proficiency in risk management, root cause analysis, and CAPA methodologies.Detail-oriented and analytical mindset, with the ability to review and analyze complex data and documentation.Excellent organizational and project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.Certification in quality assurance or regulatory affairs (e.g., ASQ Certified Quality Auditor, RAPS Certified Quality Assurance Professional) is a plus.Benefits:Competitive salaryPaid time off and holidaysProfessional development opportunities

column2: Ajanta Pharma is looking for Officer - Maintenance Store to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey   Inventory Management: Maintain accurate records of inventory levels, stock movements, and usage patterns for maintenance materials, spare parts, tools, and equipment.    Procurement: Coordinate the procurement process for maintenance supplies, including sourcing suppliers, obtaining price quotes, negotiating contracts, and issuing purchase orders.    Vendor Management: Build and maintain relationships with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely delivery of materials, negotiate favorable terms and pricing, and resolve any issues or discrepancies.    Stock Replenishment: Monitor inventory levels and reorder points to determine when to replenish stock. Place orders for replenishment items in a timely manner to prevent stockouts and delays in maintenance activities.    Storage and Organization: Ensure that maintenance materials and supplies are stored, organized, and labeled appropriately in the maintenance store or warehouse. Implement proper storage practices to prevent damage, loss, or deterioration of inventory items.    Quality Control: Inspect incoming materials and supplies for quality, accuracy, and compliance with specifications. Reject or return defective or non-conforming items and follow up with suppliers as necessary.    Issue and Distribution: Receive requests for maintenance materials and issue them to maintenance technicians or other authorized personnel as needed. Maintain accurate records of material issuance and usage.    Documentation and Reporting: Generate reports on inventory levels, material usage, procurement activities, and stock movements. Analyze data to identify trends, track costs, and make recommendations for process improvements.    Compliance and Safety: Ensure compliance with safety regulations, environmental requirements, and company policies related to the storage, handling, and disposal of maintenance materials and hazardous substances.
column13: vendor management, inventory control, warehouse operations, documentation, purchase, store keeping, logistics, purchase order, inventory, warehouse, spare parts, safety regulations, stores maintenance, material management, procurement, inventory management

column2: The Sr IT Technologist (Data Engineer) role is responsible for delivering data architecture solutions aligned with business capability needs and enterprise standards   This role works with DA Solution Architects, Business Solution Architects and Technical Architects and external service providers to ensure data and information models and technologies align with stated architecture strategies and Medtronic s standards and delivery capabilities   In a delivery capacity, this role will work with Business Analysts to review and complete business capability needs, definitions, and requirements, data analysis, data modeling, technical specification writing, and working with development organizations to ensure designs are delivered           A DAY IN THE LIFE      Coordinate data model, flow, and technology aspects of solution architecture design, implementation, and modification activities across projects, teams and key process and technology leaders.    Ensure all data architecture aspects of solution design and analysis work within the Architecture Definition Document is documented and included in the architecture repositories. Generate Solution Architecture, Data Model, and ETL specifications to match business outcome requirements.    Consult with business and technology (application, infrastructure) development projects to fit systems and desired information outcomes to business capability needs, identify when it is necessary to modify the solution architecture to accommodate project needs.    Partner with Business Solution Architects and Analysts and Data Modelers on requirements gathering or clarification and ensure alignment to desired business outcomes.    Works with and advises stakeholders, project teams, and peers in areas assigned on project needs and design.    Estimate work effort for development and enhancement requests supporting individual projects and broader team and enterprise strategies.    Understand and use standard tools, processes, designs, and methodologies for project management, documentation, system development, and implementation.    Actively support the architecture process, its outcome and ongoing results to senior leadership across Medtronic business and technology globally.    Ensure adherence to the defined IT governance activities associated with the Solution Selection Policy Procedure (ie, architecture boards, governance councils).    Partner with the Enterprise Project Management Office (EPMO) to ensure alignment and execution of plans with project deliveries.    Ensure Medtronics systems and information are protected in accordance with Medtronics Information Protection Policies and Standards, as well as best Information Protection practices.        BASIC QUALIFICATIONS        You are a hands-on, pro-active professional who can keep oversight of complex processes    Future target end state is Snowflake, but you at least have experience with Oracle databases, data warehouses, data modelling, ETL and BI    You have experience with SQL, eg you are able to develop new ETL procedures and fine-tune existing SQL code for efficiency and maintenance reasons    SAP data structure/tables and/or functional knowledge    You are flexible and pragmatic, problem solving mindset    You have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision required    You are a team player    Excellent English communication skills (verbal written), Dutch is a plus    Experience with Agile/Scrum is a plus    Experience in the Supply Chain area is a plus        EDUCATION REQUIREMENT:      Bachelors Degree        YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:      5+ years of IT experience with Master s degree        SPECIALIZED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:      5+ years of experience aligned to a relevant architecture discipline (data engineering, analytics development)    3+ years of experience with cloud-based solutions (eg, applications (SaaS), platforms (PaaS), and infrastructure (IaaS)) within an Enterprise environment    Oracle, PL/SQL, Snowflake, SAP BW    Git Concepts    Informatica Cloud Integration Services (IICS)            DESIRED/PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS     Previous Medtronic experience    5+ years of experience working with large enterprise systems solutions    Excellent leadership and teamwork skills    Strong analytical and critical thinking skills    Strong collaboration and influencing skills    Broad knowledge of data analysis/database design technologies/tools in an operational environment    Strong technical acumen, decision making, and influence skills across all levels of an organization    Strong communication skills, including with employees, clients, senior management and vendors    Solid presentation skills, including the ability to translate data concepts and technical information into business terms (eg, ability to explain complex technical solutions and architecture strategies to non-technical resources)    Strong results orientation (driving to deadlines, financial targets, project goals, etc)    Ability to work collaboratively and partner with employees, leaders, clients, and vendors    Demonstrated ability to work in a global, virtual organization    Work experience in the Medical Device Industry, or other regulated industry    Ability to mentor and develop business, architecture, and technical resources    Able to work independently as well as cooperatively

column1: MDM Data Steward - Customer Master Domain
column2: We are urgently hiring for MDM  Overview :As an MDM Data Steward in Amneal Pharmaceuticals, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality, consistency, and governance of customer data across the organization. This position requires a strong understanding of data management principles, project management skills, stakeholder management capabilities, and preferably prior experience in Master Data Management (MDM). You will be responsible for data governance, data rationalization, and driving initiatives to improve data quality and usability within Amneal. The primary domain for this position is Customer Master data, but the candidate will work very closely with all master data domains including Product master, Vendor master as well as several reference data domains.   Key Responsibilities:     1. Data   Governance:Develop   and enforce data governance policies, standards, and procedures for the   Customer Master Domain.Collaborate   with cross-functional teams to ensure compliance with data governance   policies and procedures.2. Data   Management:Oversee   the lifecycle of customer master data, including creation, maintenance, and   retirement processes.Identify   and resolve data quality issues, working closely with business stakeholders   and IT teams.Implement   data management best practices to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and   consistency.3. Data   Rationalization:Conduct   data profiling and analysis to identify duplicate, inconsistent, or redundant   data within the Customer Master Domain.Lead   data rationalization efforts to standardize and consolidate customer data   across disparate systems and sources.4. Project   Management:Engage   in MDM projects related to the Customer Master Domain, including data   migration, integration, and system enhancements.Implement   a Customer MDM solution, including customer hierarchies, data cleansing and   data mastering and approval flows. This data will be used in downstream   systems like eCommerce platforms, supply chain systems and others. 5. Stakeholder   Management:Engage   with business stakeholders to understand their data requirements and   priorities.Act   as a liaison between business users, IT teams, and external vendors to   address data-related issues and concerns.Build   strong relationships with stakeholders to promote data governance and drive   alignment on data management initiatives.Given   the global user base, effective verbal and written communications are   critical to success. Experience :      2+years of experience working in Data Governance or Data Management within        a global manufacturing company  2+ years of experience working with data in the specific domain (i.e.,        Customer, Product, Material, Vendor) in an ERP system context (Item/Material        master, BOM, Routing, Production, Customer master, Vendor master)Interested candidate can share CVs @ bhuvneshwari.rathore@amneal.com  Subject : CV for MDM
column13: Master Data Management, Data Steward

column2: We are looking for a team member to support our analytics team based out of US. Robust analytics is a priority for our businesses, as the product potential has major implications to a wide range of disciplines.    It is essential to have someone who understands and aspires to implement innovative analytics techniques to drive our insights generation across different franchises.    This role is responsible for executing global market research projects and managing a consistent, timely market research process across global products. This includes finalizing questionnaires, developing recruiting lists, aggregating data, interpreting results, cross-referencing secondary sources, and reporting findings    The role requires a close partnership with market researchers based in the US and EU, as well as external agencies that manage panels and collect data on our behalf.        People:   Maintain effective relationship with the end stakeholders within the allocated GBU and tasks - with an end objective to develop education and communication content as per requirement   Actively lead and develop SGH operations associates and ensure new technologies are leveraged   Initiate the contracting process and related documents within defined timelines; and   Collaborate with global stakeholders for project planning and setting up the timelines and maintaining budget    Performance indicators:   Feedback from (end stakeholders) on overall satisfaction    Weightage:   20%     Performance:   Prepare dashboard on contract execution counts and in pipeline   Text analytics to automate Contract process content and create repository for frequently used legal clause   In collaboration with the Data Strategy team /Global Procurement/relevant Global functions and Global Legal colleagues, provide Legal input for commercial data contracts   Co-ordinate with Global Procurement, as needed, on the preparation of legal documentation for commercial data contracts and amendments   Attend and contribute to Global data contracting discussions and decisions, providing legal and business partner support   Draft, review and negotiate legal language in alignment with objectives for data acquisition/ use cases   Assist in negotiations necessary to ensure Sanofi s interests are protected and assist in preparing legal replies   Maintain the SharePoint site where all relevant contract documents are stored   Provide timely updates and alerts on next steps to be taken - renew, cancel, raise PO, etc.   Organize all data contracting background required to understand contract history   Draft terms of Agreements / Deals for contract extension, new and amendment.   Contract interpretation - ensuring the contract will deliver expected outcome and identify any problematic holes in Vendor contracts   Reports on contract implementation / execution status   Contract Repository organization          Weightage:   30%     Process:   Support delivery of projects in terms of resourcing, coordination, quality, timeliness, efficiency, and high technical standards for deliveries made by the medical writing group, including scientific documents and clinical/medical reports   Secure adherence to compliance procedures and internal/operational risk controls in accordance with all applicable standards   Refresh report on frequency/cycle basis (weekly / monthly / quarterly / annually) ,  along with QC checks for each refresh   Use latest tools / technologies / methodologies and partner with internal teams to provide support on all sort of regular and adhoc business analytics activities like build, maintenance and enhancements of such systems   Ability to work cross-functionally, gather requirements, analyse data, and generate insights and reports that can be used by the GBU    Performance indicators:   Feedback from stakeholders on satisfaction with deliverables Adherence to plan/calendar    Weightage:   25%     Stakeholder:   Work closely with global teams and/ external vendors to ensure the end-to-end effective project delivery of the designated publication/medical education deliverables also to prioritize work and deliver on time-sensitive requests   Be able to provide and defend gathered intelligence, methodology, content, and conclusions to the global leadership in a clear, concise format    Performance indicators:   Feedback from stakeholders on satisfaction with deliverables    Weightage: 20%           About you       Experience  : 8+ years of experience in pharmaceutical product market research and commercial analytics and data. Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced analytical techniques     Soft skills  : Strong learning agility; Ability to manage ambiguous environments, and to adapt to changing needs of the business; Good interpersonal and communication skills; strong presentation skills a must; Team player who is curious, dynamic, result oriented and can work collaboratively; Ability to think strategically in an ambiguous environment; Ability to operate effectively in an international matrix environment, with ability to work across time zones; Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques        Technical skills  :    Knowledge using analytical platforms (e.g. Databricks, Jupyter Notebook, SQL developers, etc)    Experience of using analytical tools like Power BI    Depth of knowledge on contract execution process (needs identification, requirement analysis & identification of vendors to contract administration) and elements (cost/rebate/bonus/price protection, terms, termination clause, no guarantee on volume)    A continual pulse on existing agreements/deals    An understanding of changes to standard clauses    Knowledge of accepted wording adjustments    Understanding of risk management relating to non-compliance    Attention to detail and strong understanding of agreements/deals    Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications    Expertise in Market data    Experience in working with vendors    Strong collaboration skills    Strong written, and verbal communication skills    Expert knowledge of Excel and proficiency in VBA    Experience of developing and managing dashboards    Project management abilities; capable of prioritizing and handling multiple projects simultaneously    An aptitude for problem solving and strategic thinking    Ability to synthesize complex information into clear and actionable insights    Proven ability to work effectively across all levels of stakeholders and diverse functions    Solid understanding of pharmaceutical development, manufacturing, supply chain and marketing functions    Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques       Education  : Advanced degree in areas such as Management/Statistics/Decision Sciences/Engineering/Life Sciences/ Business Analytics or related field (e.g., PhD / MBA / Masters)     Languages  : Excellent knowledge in English and strong communication skills - written and spoken     Other Requirement:   Required to align to US EST work schedule to engage global insights and brand teams; This role is a sole contributor focused on development, delivery and communication of insights

Identify opportunities for process improvement within the procurement lifecycle and leverage GIS/IT solutions to streamline workflows, reduce costs, and enhance overall efficiency. Ensure that GIS/IT efforts contribute directly to improving procurement efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and overall business performance.     Develop a technology roadmap that outlines the planned GIS/IT initiatives over a specific time frame.     Prioritize technology investments based on their potential impact on procurement processes, cost savings, and strategic objectives.     Stay abreast of emerging GIS and IT trends, tools, and technologies that could bring innovation to procurement processes.     Evaluate and pilot new technologies, such as machine learning, artificial intelligence, and advanced analytics, to enhance decision-making and efficiency.     Design GIS/IT solutions with scalability and flexibility in mind, anticipating the evolving needs of the global procurement function.     Evaluate cloud-based solutions and scalable architectures to accommodate growth and changing business requirements. Collaborate with external GIS/IT vendors to ensure effective delivery of services and solutions.     Maintain stakeholder relationships and stay abreast of emerging technologies to drive innovation. Functional testing experience along with building test cases and test scripts execution     Good to have knowledge on Enterprise Asset Management, Ariba SCC and EWM applications     Ability to analyze data, generate insights, and make strategic recommendations.     Certifications in SAP modules preferred.     Bachelor s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, a related field, or equivalent work experience; Masters degree preferred.

Improved integration or divestment capabilities through a standardized methodology.              Main responsibilities:      In the context of the iShift Program, the main duties of the Solution Delivery Junior Order to Serve position are (    under the supervision and support of the Solution Delivery Order to Serve Expert)        Ensure consistency of the solution for Domain and adherence to Standard and Core Model guiding principles (contribution to Design Authority).      Ensure that risks and issues are identified, formalized, and communicated to the Solution Delivery Order to Serve Team Lead.      Contribute to Application Maintenance Services (AMS) activities as project handover, L3 support & solution validation.      Contribute to Integration topics with other domains.      Delivery of the different project phases under the Co-Delivery model: scoping, design, build, testing, production cut over and post go live hyper care and knowledge transfer to Application Maintenance Services (AMS).      Ensure Solution documentation & capitalization of knowledge; contribute to Knowledge transfer and upskilling as required; provide inputs & proposals for documentation templates & deliverable formats evolutions.      Contribute to the iShift Program industrialization.      Contribute to the improvement to project methodology together with the PMO team.      Contribute to handle Escalations with SAP, relationship with Max Attention team for Domain.      Correctly use the Program Tools for Domain (JIRA, HPALM, )          Scoping        Contribute to Scoping studies in collaboration with the Business Enablement team.      Provide workload estimations for new scope to be deployed for Order to Serve domain, or new functionalities to be implemented as part of Continuous Improvement.          Design of the Solution        Support the Solution Delivery Order to Serve Expert in collaboration with the Business Enablement team, the Global Design or Fit-Gap workshops to design the solution based on industry best practices, GBU & Global Support Functions business needs.      Support the Solution Delivery Order to Serve Expert to propose adequate SAP solutions minimizing gaps with the SAP standard functionalities by challenging business requirements and specify for customizing and development the agreed solutions.      Contribute to assess impact analysis for application changes for SAP and satellites applications.      Collect and consolidate impacts for legacy systems.      Contribute to the design of transversal streams:      Master data management and migration strategy      Analytics      Authorizations (UAM)      Process controls      Other Solution delivery Domain for integration topics User experience (UX)        Collect and consolidate the information on Order to Serve Domain required for Infrastructure and application landscape definition.      Deliver all design deliverables defined by the program and under Solution Delivery responsibility (e.g.: Solution Documents, Functional specifications, Configuration documents )       Develop him/herself on the new capabilities provided by SAP S/4HANA on his/her perimeter; contribute to continuous improvement of the solution with Prototyping (Proof of Concepts).          Development and testing        Organize, complete, unit-test and document the configuration of the system.      Contribute with the development team to the specific developments (functional specifications update & inputs for unit test).      Ensure quality of developments / Contribute to audits & quality KPI follow up.      Organize, document, and execute integration and system tests.      Contribute to user acceptance tests and finalize the solution (address defects identified).      Use properly the documentation and testing tools as defined by iShift Program.      Complete all deliverables defined by the program and under Solution Delivery responsibility (e.g. test protocols, test reports )          Migration and go-live        Contribute to migration activities related to the Order to Serve stream.      Document and execute cut-over activities related to the Order to Serve stream.      Update training documents & contribute to trainings on the Solution.      Ensure go-live support and hypercare activities.        Handover to Application Maintenance Services (AMS): contribute to the project transition to AMS for some of the functional Order to Serve domains (including knowledge transfer sessions and handover of ongoing incidents).           Experience   :      8+ years of SAP experience with minimum 2 years in S/4 HANA platform.      Proven SAP S/4 Hana on premise experience is required.      3 full lifecycle SAP roll out deployments experience is required.      Demonstrate knowledge in customizing for modules related to Sales and Distribution, preferably in a Pharmaceutical / Consumer Products industry.      Functional Expertise required for some of the Order to Serve domains like:      Sales Order Management (EDI orders, Ecommerce orders, drop shipments).      Sales Order fulfilment (Availability check, Product Allocation, Material Determination, Listings and Exclusions, Free Goods, Text Determination, Incompletion checks).      Outbound Delivery Processing and Proof of Delivery.      Billing (invoice split, collective billing, invoice lists, proforma invoice).      Advanced Returns Management.      Credit/Debit Notes processing.      Condition contracts and Settlement Management.       System configuration experience on some of the above-mentioned modules is also required.       Proficiency in SAP S/4HANA Sales and Distribution, configuration, and integration with other modules such as MM, FI, Controlling, Business Partners. Knowledge of additional SAP functional domains as advantage.      Proven experience working in major IT consulting firms as functional expert is a plus.      Experience of SAP projects in complex and international environment is a plus.      Experience with good change control practices and system validation for GxP and SOX requirements for SAP (including use of SolDoc, CHARM, etc.) is a plus.      At ease with Microsoft Office tools, and in general with IS tools.      Knowledge of Agile Project methodologies and tools (Jira, Confluence) is a plus.      SAP ABAP basic knowledge, reading of ABAP code, debugging experience is a plus.         Soft Skills   :      Team player, service-oriented, Solution-oriented, social skills, and strong ability to work in a team.      Dynamic, results driven.      Analytical and synthetic, able to formalize solutions.      Active listener, able to challenge requirements.      Strong oral and written communication skills.      Rigorous, autonomous.      Accountability and Reliability.      Ability to evaluate risks & manage appropriate escalations.      Flexibility to travel up to maximum 20% of time.         Education   :      Bachelor s degree (required) or Master s degree (preferred) in finance, or in Supply chain, or in science, or in IT or in Engineering. Operational Management:   - Streamline and optimize operational processes to ensure efficiency and cost-effectiveness.   - Oversee inventory management, including procurement, storage, and distribution.   - Liaise with suppliers and vendors to maintain quality standards and manage relationships effectively.   - Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify areas for improvement and implement solutions.2. column2: You will be responsible for managing a designated sales territory or customer portfolio and building strong relationships with clients    Here are some key responsibilities associated with the role:Sales Target Achievement: Your primary objective is to meet or exceed sales targets set by the organization    You will develop sales strategies and tactics to maximize revenue from existing clients and acquire new customers within your assigned territory    Customer Relationship Management: You will build and maintain strong relationships with key customers, such as distributors, retailers, restaurants, or food service providers    This involves understanding their needs, providing product information and support, addressing any concerns or issues, and working towards long-term partnerships    Market Research and Analysis: You will conduct market research to identify potential customers, understand market trends, and stay updated on competitors' activities    This information will help you identify new sales opportunities, develop targeted marketing strategies, and position the organization's food products effectively    Sales Presentations and Product Demonstrations: You will deliver compelling sales presentations and product demonstrations to showcase the features, benefits, and value of the organization's food products    This may involve conducting tastings, providing samples, and highlighting unique selling points to generate customer interest and drive sales    Order Management and Sales Support: You will handle order management processes, including order placement, tracking, and fulfillment    You will coordinate with internal departments, such as logistics and operations, to ensure timely delivery of products and resolve any order-related issues    Additionally, you will provide sales support by addressing customer inquiries, providing product information, and offering after-sales assistance as needed    Sales Reporting and Analysis: You will maintain accurate and up-to-date sales records, including customer interactions, sales data, and revenue forecasts    You will prepare regular sales reports, analyze sales performance, identify trends, and provide insights to management to optimize sales strategies and improve outcomes    Product Knowledge and Training: You will stay updated on the organization's food products, including their ingredients, nutritional values, and usage instructions    You may also conduct product training sessions for customers and internal sales teams to ensure a thorough understanding of the products and their benefits

formulating unit economics for our diverse product range, contributing significantly to our cost analysis and strategic financial planning.Reporting Excellence: Play a critical role in crafting and efficiency.Collaboration with Banking and Partners: Engage in effective liaison and coordination with banking partners and other third-party entities involved in Finance and Compliance, ensuring Word, and Powerpoint) and excellent working knowledge of accounting software (Zoho experience preferred)- Excellent Verbal and Written English communication skills.- An eye for detail

One of a reputed Pharmaceutical client is looking for Qualified professional for the role of  Operations Head to be based at Mumbai        About the Company Profile -       It is a fully integrated, research-oriented pharma company engaged in the manufacturing and marketing of Formulations (Finished Dosage Forms) and Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs). They have seven decades of presence in the Indian Pharma market and a strong foothold in the international market across more than 50 countries, a USD 150 million company. column1: Principal IT Technologist - Invoice To Pay
column2: As an SAP Accounts Payable IT Technical Analyst, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing the SAP system to support Accounts Payable operations including several upstream and downstream processes    Your role in the SAP AP & EEM (Concur) IT Team involves working with the Sourcing, Accounts Payable, EEM and Treasury business and the AP (SAP, ReadSoft), EEM (Concur) and Kofax IT Support teams to conduct the following duties; Configuring and maintaining SAP Accounts Payable and Employee Expense Management (Concur) applications to meet Medtronic functional requirements (policy workflows, integrating with upstream processes of procurement, travel, event management, expenses, services, contracted services and contingent sourcing as well as with downstream processes related to integrations with banks or check management)    This individual would be responsible to configure systems for accounts payable invoice processing, ensuring 2-way and 3-way matching, workflow for non-PO based invoices, payment approvals, check and bank payments, based on payment policies and terms, manual and automated bank integrations and cash management, SOX Compliance and risk management   You will conduct the Concur Admin role liaising with SAP Concur for support and reporting requests, provision Concur user access, conduct Concur configuration to meet country allowances and develop Concur (Cognos) reports to meet business requirements   You would also be supporting current and future Accounts Payable solutions for electronic invoicing and invoice verification, invoice scanning (Kofax) and bank payment processes and other process optimizations (Dynamic Discounting and Supply Chain Finance)   You will act as a liaison between the sourcing, accounts payable and IT departments, ensuring that the SAP system aligns with the organizations Accounts Payable goals and policies   This position is expected to engage with the business and analyse and delineate requirements, draft and review function specifications, configure SAP and Concur systems for the AP & EEM functional areas, engage with development teams, plan and execute testing and eventually deploy and support the functionality in production     A Day in the Life                Upstream Process Integration:         o      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate SAP ECC Accounts Payable functionalities into upstream processes, including direct and indirect procurement, travel and expense management, ad-hoc and contracted services, contingent sourcing, and any manual or automated payments.       o      Ensure seamless data flow and real-time synchronization between Accounts Payable and upstream modules to optimize end-to-end business processes.               Accounts Payable Core (SAP, ReadSoft and Kofax) Processes:        o      Lead the design and implementation of efficient invoice processing workflows, balancing manual, and automated procedures.       o      Support and deliver solutions for accounts payable invoice scanning and approval workflow solution systems (Kofax and ReadSoft)       o      Implement payment processes in adherence to payment policies, terms, and regulatory requirements.       o      Manage system processes for check and bank payments, ensuring accuracy and compliance with financial protocols.       o      Provide IT oversight and direction for support tickets and error handling related to Accounts Payable & EEM (Concur).               Employee Expense Management (Concur)        o      Provide backup support to the Concur Admin role (including   provisioning of Concur user access and updating the Concur configuration to fulfil   company Travel and Expense policy and country allowances).       o      Liaise with SAP Concur to provide support, configuration changes or reporting requirements.       o      Prepare Concur (Cognos) reporting to fulfil business requirements.               Bank Integrations:        o      Implement and maintain both manual and automated bank integrations to facilitate secure and timely financial transactions.       o      Collaborate with IT and financial teams to troubleshoot and resolve any issues related to bank payments and integrations.               Cash Management and Treasury Functions:        o      Support the Treasury team to implement solutions for effective cash management within the SAP environment.       o      SOX Compliance and Risk Management:       o      Ensure systems are in compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) regulations and internal controls related to Accounts Payable system processes.       o      Identify and mitigate risks associated with payment processes, data security, and financial transactions.               Documentation and Reporting:        o      Maintain comprehensive documentation of integration processes, configurations, and workflows.       o      Coordinate requirements and design regular reports for analysis related to Accounts Payable performance, identifying opportunities for continuous improvement.       o      Support the business to provide AP & EEM (Concur) Reporting.               Training and Support:        o      Provide training to end-users on new functionalities, ensuring a smooth transition and optimal utilization of SAP capabilities.       o      Offer ongoing support to resolve issues, answer queries, and address concerns related to Accounts Payable and integrated processes  .         14   + years of experience with a bachelor s degree or 5+ years of experience with an advanced degree or equivalent work experience.              Proven experience in SAP support/implementations, with a focus on Accounts Payable and integrated modules.              Strong understanding of financial processes, payment policies, and regulatory compliance.              Experience with ReadSoft, Kofax and Employee Expense Management (Concur) Applications.              Experience with Global rollouts.              Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.              Problem-solving mindset and ability to troubleshoot complex integration issues.              Familiarity with payments to banks/cash management and treasury functions.              Knowledge of SOX compliance and risk management practices.              Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities.              SQL, PowerBI and (Concur) Cognos Reporting experience.              Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.              Attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.     Must Have: Minimum Requirements     Nice to Have             Experience implementing SAP S4/HANA.              Prior Pharma and/or Medical Device experience is desired.

column2: A knowledge worker and a subject matter expert who is assigned accountability for the data specifications and data quality of specifically assigned business entities, subject areas, or databases. Ensure application of FAIR data principles in TRD and oversees the adherence to FAIR principles by other team members. Track and follow the business data quality and ensure it is fit for consumption from business end. Independently monitor the level of data quality of individual data sources & datasets as per define business metrics and produce Data Quality Dashboards.    Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:      Prior experience working as Data Steward, driving Data Management capabilities such as Data Governance, Data Quality, Metadata Management (including business glossary & data lineage), Master Data Management and data ownership.   Knowledge of Pharma, Supply Chain, Master Data - Material Master, Data Management & Data Governance principles    Ability to drive Data Working Group and Cross Domain forums fostering data driven mindset across the organization.   Define and implement data quality rules, and remediation of underlying data quality issues enabling trust in data   Understanding issue management process to drive remediate of data quality issues collaborating with stakeholders across domains.   Experience driving Business Glossary and Data Lineage initiatives, and complex discussions around data ownership. Drive identification of Critical Data Elements across business process & systems, and implementation of governance for coverage.   Proven experience in Alteryx, Informatica Data Quality (IDQ), Qlik Sense, Power BI, and SAP applications. The ability to drive meaningful change and navigate complex challenges with confidence.   Excellent communication skills and a knack for building strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels.         Role Requirements     Opportunity to be hands-on working with cutting-edge tools such as Alteryx, Informatica Data Quality (IDQ), Qlik Sense, Power BI, and SAP applications.   Immersion in the dynamic worlds of Pharma, Supply Chain, and Master Data primarily material master gaining valuable insights and expertise.   The opportunity to shape and refine strategy for Data Management & Data Governance, ensuring alignment with industry standards and organizational objectives.   Collaboration with cross-functional teams and senior management to drive domain-based Data Governance Operating Model   Opportunities to identify areas for process optimization and innovation, enabling technology adoption and value realization.

column2: TDS will play a critical role in Therapy development for Medtronic TAVR therapy in India subcontinent through ensure safe adoption and growth of the Medtronic TAVI Systems and future catheter-based therapy technologies. TDS will be mentored and trained by our Therapy Training manager and fully trained TDSs for a period of     6 Months    where they are expected to develop technical and clinical expertise to provide support for therapy delivery.        KEY RESPONSIBILITIES          1.        TDSs are expected to go through intensive technical training on Medtronic TVAR Therapy and finish all certifications (BP-1, BP-2 and BP-3 for both imaging and procedure) over a period of next one year. This training will be facilitated by Training manager and Mentor and TDS is expected to shadow him/her. Objective of this training is to Develop and maintain comprehensive clinical and technical product knowledge.       2.        TDS will be responsible for executing administrative tasks assigned by Mentor but not limited to below list.       o        Responsible for product inventory to include shipments, usage and return of product.       o        Support event planning and proctor logistics.       o        Report device complaints to proper departments within quality assurance       o        Schedules travel arrangements to ensure multiple objectives are accomplished.       o        Supports heart teams with appropriate products, clinical literature and pre case planning       o        Maintain hospital eligibility/access with various vendor credentialing services if applicable       3. Drive KOL engagement activities in assigned territory            Qualifications             Must Have: Minimum Requirements                Minimum 4-6 yrs   in sales experience in    Engineering/ science graduates or Clinical designation (RN, Radiology technician, Scrub Tech, Physician Assistant, perfusionist, Cath lab technicians.              Position requires excellent written and verbal communication skills to communicate effectively with key stakeholders (Colleagues, supervisors, healthcare practitioners).              Strong learning agility and problem-solving skills and organizing and prioritizing work              Tenacity to stay the course despite setbacks              Demonstrates integrity and recognized as a role model by their peers and manager.              Clinical selling aptitude with strong interpersonal and presentation skills.            Strong relations with leading Cardiologists in respective territory / existing market         PHYSICAL JOB REQUIRMENTS:         1.        The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.       2.        While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer and communicate with peers and co-workers.       3.        Extended periods of time doing computer-based work and Able to lift 20 pounds.       4.        Ability to use computers and CT reconstruction programs.       5.         Ability to travel e75% of the time by car train and plane including weekends as weekends are spent in case support or programs.         6.        Wear lead apron for long periods of time (2-3 hours on average).       7.        Ability to work in Cath Labs or ORs with radiation exposure.       8. column2: Common analytics by GBU and for Global functions to improve performance and cost management    Transversal data consolidation as well as more granular analyses    Common budget tools by GBU     - Facilitating a seamless integration of planning and actual data setting-up automation in reporting to enable Global Shared Services (SBS)     Support SBS strategy by implementing an end-to-end approach (e.g. P2P fully covered by integrated Group solutions from eBuy to AP Invoicing, T&E, etc.)    Opportunity to consolidate new activities in Shared Services (e.g. Master Data Management, Credit Management) and to develop global Shared Services organization models (e.g. T&E)    Support reporting factories     - Simplifying processes and Sanofi users experience     State-of-the-art global systems ensuring an end-to-end process integration while providing a simplified user s experience    Major changes to reporting or processes handled centrally at once    One source of truth on master data and a common automated internal control framework    Improved integration or divestment capabilities through a standardized methodologyBrief introduction of the department, team, purpose, and missions. Highlight what is unique to your team.        Job Summary:      The Digital SAP quality Expert will participate to the implementation of Business Value Project (BVP) and / or enhancement of the CORE solution. He/She may also be participating to deploy projects at Sanofi sites according to the program roadmap.    She/He ensures the optimal usage of the solution for the domain of quality in integration with logistic, production, HSE, master data management.        Responsibilities :      Business Alignment and Solution ownership      Maintain, Improve & complete the core Quality core model    Deploy core solution on site & be the ambassador of iShift    Maximize the usage of core solution and ensure all enhancements and change requests implemented for sites are compliant with the Core solution    Animate Fit To Standard session, identify gaps, perform Detail Design & build the solution in codelivery model with our integrator    Create test cases and perform functional unit and integration tests    Support key users in the User Acceptance Test    Contribute to planning and execution of go-live preparation, cutover and hypercare tasks for their domain      Organizational change management      Support identification of change impacts to the end users ways of working    Define actions to help facilitate the business organization with the changes in business processes    Train the key users in the new business processes and the new S/4 core model solution    Promote the core model solution with the business stakeholders and users    Provide advice and support to improve efficiency of cross-functional practices      Data management      Working with key users to support activities to cleanse data in the legacy systems and prepare them for extraction and load into the new S4/HANA environment    Working with the business and technical teams to support data extraction from legacy systems based on data requirements for the new S4/HANA solution    Working with the business and the functional-technical teams to support data migration activities from legacy systems into the new solution      Cut-over and Go-Live      Identify cutover steps for their domain to contribute to the creation of a cutover plan    Execute the cut over activities for their domain. Support key users in the execute of business cutover tasks.    Support the site during the hypercare phase to stabilize the new solution      Ongoing support      Support further stabilization efforts post hypercare    Lead value improvement activities to ensure maximum value generation of implemented solutions.    As the Sanofi S4/HANA Core Model template evolves over time, lead initiatives to retrofit future improvements to live sites      People Management      Communicate in transparencies with his/her fellow co-worker and management    Contribute to the transfer of know-how, experience and best practices within his/her domain and beyond         About you     Education      Graduated from Engineering school or Business school    Master s degree      Experience & knowledge      2 to 7 years work experience including 1 to 3+ years as solution designer    Significant experience of Quality Processes in SAP managed industrial plants    Experience on SAP PP-PI & eWM would be a plus    Experience on HSE would be a plus    Experience in Life Science industries would be a plus    Experience in SAP S4HANA would be a plus    General knowledge on ERP architectures and integration/interface technologies (qRFC, Idoc )      Core competencies      SAP QM business processes and relevant SAP solutions (PP-PI, eWM, MDM, S4HANA, Fiori,)    Experience in agile project approach (JIRA experience a plus)    Ability to challenge processes and practices, open minded and active listening    Knowledge of pharma industry regulatory context (GxP)    Deep project management skills with capacity to adapt to a changing environment    Ability to collaborate and build effective networks inside and outside Sanofi    Strong capability to impact and influence, negotiation skills and conflict management    Service/Customer mindset    Accountability, reliability    Excellent communication skills    Fluent in English (verbal, written)        What makes this position unique      Sanofi s strategic direction is to harmonize and standardize business processes and to embrace the digital transformation of DIGITAL Industrial Affairs organizational unit. A key pillar of this digital transformation is the transition from SAP ECC to S4/HANA.    As part of the Hyderabad ERP Delivery team the candidate has the opportunity to join Sanofi s journey towards digitalization and to shape the business solution for the future by implementing a global S4/HANA digital core.        TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT      Based in Hyderabad, this job requires to collaborate in a global and matrixial environment with international business and digital teams    English is the usual working language    This job requires periodic business trips to digital or industrial locations    This job requires to work within structured environments with formal procedures, deliverables, compliance rules and reporting duties

column2: As an SAP Accounts Payable IT Technical Analyst, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing the SAP system to support Accounts Payable operations including several upstream and downstream processes    Your role in the SAP AP & EEM (Concur) IT Team involves working with the Sourcing, Accounts Payable, EEM and Treasury business and the AP (SAP, ReadSoft), EEM (Concur) and Kofax IT Support teams to conduct the following duties; Configuring and maintaining SAP Accounts Payable and Employee Expense Management (Concur) applications to meet Medtronic functional requirements (policy workflows, integrating with upstream processes of procurement, travel, event management, expenses, services, contracted services and contingent sourcing as well as with downstream processes related to integrations with banks or check management)    This individual would be responsible to configure systems for accounts payable invoice processing, ensuring 2-way and 3-way matching, workflow for non-PO based invoices, payment approvals, check and bank payments, based on payment policies and terms, manual and automated bank integrations and cash management, SOX Compliance and risk management   You will conduct the Concur Admin role liaising with SAP Concur for support and reporting requests, provision Concur user access, conduct Concur configuration to meet country allowances and develop Concur (Cognos) reports to meet business requirements   You would also be supporting current and future Accounts Payable solutions for electronic invoicing and invoice verification, invoice scanning (Kofax) and bank payment processes and other process optimizations (Dynamic Discounting and Supply Chain Finance)   You will act as a liaison between the sourcing, accounts payable and IT departments, ensuring that the SAP system aligns with the organizations Accounts Payable goals and policies   This position is expected to engage with the business and analyse and delineate requirements, draft and review function specifications, configure SAP and Concur systems for the AP & EEM functional areas, engage with development teams, plan and execute testing and eventually deploy and support the functionality in production     A Day in the Life           o      Manage, architect and support SAP BW4 HANA, SAP S4 and SAP HANA database, ensuring high availability and performance.       o      Develop, Implement, and maintain SAP BW/4 HANA and SAP HANA solutions, taking a leading role on Enterprise Operational Data reporting projects.       o      Monitor and implement SLT / Smart Data Integration for HANA to facilitate data integration and synchronization.       o      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and document functional requirements.       o      Lead and support SAP projects from planning and design to implementation and maintenance.       o      Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues and provide on-call support as needed.       o      Leveraging cross functional knowledge as required (OS, Networking, ABAP, etc.) to identify and debug issues quickly.       o      Ensure data security, system stability, and regulatory compliance for SAP BW/4 HANA systems.       o      Stay up to date with SAP best practices and technology trends.        Must Have: Minimum Requirements             Bachelor s degree              14+ years of experience with a bachelor s degree and 8+ years of S/4 experience with an advanced degree      Nice to Have             Previous Medtronic experience              Extensive experience in SAP projects, with a focus on end-to-end development, SAP BW/4 HANA, SAP S/4 HANA, SAP HANA database, SAP ECC.              Expertise in Smart Data Integration for HANA.              Experience integrating SAP / Non-SAP ERP platforms with SAP BW/4 HANA and upstream/downstream systems (including API Development)              Strong cross-functional knowledge on HANA Database, SAP Functional (esp. Finance and Sales), and other SAP technologies and able to translate those skills into technical solutions for issue resolution.              Deep understanding of ABAP skills is required.              Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.              Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.              Proven ability to work independently and in a team.              Prior Pharma and/or Medical Device experience

Job Summary:      Being part of Solution Delivery Controlling team and under the supervision and the support of the Solution Delivery Controlling Expert, the Junior Controlling position will participate to the design and the deployment of a single technical solution covering Controlling standardized processes in a single SAP solution for all businesses on all geographies.      Domain covers Controlling Processes: Commercial Controlling, Industrial Controlling, Operational Reporting and Group Reporting.      Junior Controlling position will support the delivery of the solution design and project deliverables (SAP solutions design, implementation in the systems, all related documentation), for all the projects the Junior Controlling position is contributing and under the supervision and support of the Solution Delivery Controlling Expert.       Junior Controlling position will contribute to the overall consistency of the design proposed and related deliverables    .          Main responsibilities:      In the context of the iShift Program, the main duties of the Solution Delivery Junior Controlling position are (    under the supervision and support of the Solution Delivery Controlling Expert)        Ensure consistency of the solution for Domain and adherence to Standard and Core Model guiding principles (contribution to Design Authority).      Ensure that risks and issues are identified, formalized, and communicated to the Solution Delivery Controlling Team Lead.      Contribute to Application Maintenance Services (AMS) activities as project handover, L3 support & solution validation.      Contribute to Integration topics with other domains.      Delivery of the different project phases under the Co-Delivery model: scoping, design, build, testing, production cut over and post go live hyper care and knowledge transfer to Application Maintenance Services (AMS).      Ensure Solution documentation & capitalization of knowledge; contribute to Knowledge transfer and upskilling as required; provide inputs & proposals for documentation templates & deliverable formats evolutions.      Contribute to the iShift Program industrialization.      Contribute to the improvement to project methodology together with the PMO team.      Contribute to handle Escalations with SAP, relationship with Max Attention team for Domain.      Correctly use the Program Tools for Domain (JIRA, HPALM, )          Scoping          Contribute to Scoping studies in collaboration with the Business Enablement team.      Provide workload estimations for new scope to be deployed for Domain, or new functionalities to be implemented as part of Continuous Improvement.          Design of the Solution        Support the Solution Delivery Controlling Expert in collaboration with the Business Enablement team, the Global Design or Fit-Gap workshops to design the solution based on industry best practices, GBU & Global Support Functions business needs.      Support the Solution Delivery Controlling Expert to propose adequate SAP solutions minimizing gaps with the SAP standard functionalities by challenging business requirements and specify for customizing and development the agreed solutions.      Contribute to assess impact analysis for application changes for SAP and satellites applications.      Collect and consolidate impacts for legacy systems.      Contribute to the design of transversal streams:      Master data management and migration strategy      Analytics      Authorizations (UAM)      Process controls      Other Solution delivery Domain for integration topics User experience (UX)        Collect and consolidate the information on Domain required for Infrastructure and application landscape definition.      Deliver all design deliverables defined by the program and under Solution Delivery responsibility (e.g.: Solution Documents, Functional specifications, Configuration documents )       Develop him/herself on the new capabilities provided by SAP S/4HANA on his/her perimeter; contribute to continuous improvement of the solution with PODs.          Development and testing        Organize, complete, unit-test and document the configuration of the system.      Contribute with the development team to the specific developments (functional specifications update & inputs for unit test)      Ensure quality of developments / Contribute to audits & quality KPI follow up.      Organize, document, and execute integration and system tests.      Contribute to user acceptance tests and finalize the solution (address defects identified).      Use properly the documentation and testing tools as defined by iShift Program.      Complete all deliverables defined by the program and under Solution Delivery responsibility (e.g. test protocols, test reports )            Migration and go-live        Contribute to migration activities related to the stream.      Document and execute cut-over activities related to the stream.      Update training documents and deliver training on the Solution to the key users.      Ensure go-live support and hyper care activities.      Handover to Application Maintenance Services (AMS): contribute to the project transition to AMS for the functional domain (including knowledge transfer sessions and handover of ongoing incidents).             Experience   :      8+ years of SAP Experience.      Proofed SAP S/4 Hana on premise experience is required.      3 full lifecycle SAP roll out deployments experience is required.      Demonstrate knowledge in customizing for modules related to Controlling, preferably in a Pharmaceutical / Consumer Products industry.      Functional Expertise required at Project System (PS) Product Costing, Cost object controlling and Material Ledger (CO-PC), Cost Center (CO-OM), Account based profitability Analysis (CO-PA). System configuration experience on those modules is also required.     Proficiency in SAP S/4HANA Controlling, configuration, and integration with other modules such as MM, SD, PP and Plant Maintenance (PM).   Knowledge of additional SAP functional domains as advantage.      Proven experience working in major IT consulting firms as functional expert is a plus.      Experience of SAP projects in complex and international environment is a plus.     Experience with good change control practices and system validation for GxP and SOX requirements for SAP (including use of SolDoc, CHARM, etc.) is a plus.     At ease with Microsoft Office tools, and in general with IS tools.      Knowledge of Agile Project methodologies and tools (Jira, Confluence) is a plus.      SAP ABAP basic knowledge, reading of ABAP code, debugging experience is a plus.           Soft Skills   :      Team player, service-oriented, Solution-oriented, social skills, and strong ability to work in a team.      Dynamic, results driven.      Analytical and synthetic, able to formalize solutions.      Active listener, able to challenge requirements.      Strong oral and written communication skills.      Rigorous, autonomous.      Accountability and Reliability.      Ability to evaluate risks & manage appropriate escalations.      Flexibility to travel up to maximum 20% of time.         Education   :      Bachelor s degree (required) or Master s degree (preferred) in finance, or in Supply chain, or in science, or in IT or in Engineering.         Languages   :      Fluent in English.      Any other language is a plus.

column2: Entero Healthcare SolutionsAbout us : Did you know that India has 8 Lakh+ chemists, more than 60k+ distributors and still more than 30% of prescriptions go unfulfilled or partially fulfilled in our country every day. We at Entero has been trying to change that by building a robust tech driven supply chain which helps chemists in stocking better and improving the prescription fill rates. We have scaled up from zero to 4000 Cr annual revenue (Actual Revenues, Not GMV) in last 5 years, we are a trusted supply chain partner to more than 84k+ chemists and 3400+ hospitals across 495+ districts as on today. We are also healthcare supply chain partner for more than 1900 healthcare companies both MNCs and Indian.  Best Part, We are a profitable company (Yes Net profit positive, not contribution margin or order level positive). We understand the need for high growth rates and hunt for it, but basic metrics of doing everything with a sharp eye on profitability is what makes us unique.You can visit our website: www.enterohealthcare.com  Position: Purchase Executive for OTC ProductsLocation: HyderabadReporting to: Unit HeadPosition Overview: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Purchase Executive for our procurement operations and optimize our purchasing processes with one of our entities in Hyderabad. Key Responsibilities:Supplier Management: Identify and qualify reliable suppliers of pharmaceutical products, negotiate contracts and terms, and maintain strong relationships to ensure competitive pricing and timely delivery.Purchase Management: Oversee the entire purchase process, from identifying purchasing needs to placing orders, tracking shipments, and verifying receipt of goods.Inventory Management: Monitor inventory levels, forecast demand, and optimize inventory turnover to minimize stockouts and excess inventory.Cost Control: Analyze purchasing trends, identify cost-saving opportunities, negotiate discounts, rebates, and incentives with suppliers, and implement cost reduction initiatives.Quality Assurance: Ensure that all purchased pharmaceutical products meet regulatory requirements, quality standards, and specifications.Margin Enhancement: Identify opportunities to increase margins through strategic purchasing decisions, negotiating extra margins with suppliers, and optimizing product mix.Range Expansion: Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to identify new product opportunities, expand product range, and enhance product offerings to meet customer demands.Compliance: Ensure compliance with company policies, procurement regulations, and industry standards in all purchasing activities.Qualifications and Skills:Bachelor's degree in B.Pharm/Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or related field. Master's degree preferred.Minimum of 1 years of experience in procurement, preferably in the OTC Products/FMCG/healthcare industry, preferably from Pharma distribution backgroundStrong knowledge of OTC Brands and various SKUsKnowledge of regulatory requirements and quality standards in pharmaceutical procurement.Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.If your profile matches the requirement, please send your resume to subinp.kurian@enterohealthcare.com Subin P KurianHRBP South 2Entero Healthcare Solutions LtdE-Mail: subinp.kurian@enterohealthcare.com

column2: Production Planning: Develop production plans and schedules to meet customer demand while optimizing resources and minimizing production costs   Inventory Management: Monitor and control inventory levels to ensure that raw materials, work-in-progress (WIP), and finished goods are maintained at appropriate levels to meet production requirements and customer orders   Demand Forecasting: Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to forecast demand for products and materials, taking into account market trends and customer orders   Materials Procurement: Coordinate with procurement and supply chain teams to ensure the timely and cost-effective procurement of raw materials and components needed for production   Capacity Planning: Evaluate and optimize production capacity and resource utilization to meet production targets and deadlines   Production Scheduling: Create detailed production schedules, considering resource availability, machine capacity, and workforce, to ensure smooth operations and on-time delivery   Quality Control: Collaborate with quality assurance teams to ensure that production processes meet quality standards and that quality issues are promptly addressed   Data Analysis: Analyze production and inventory data to identify trends, areas for improvement, and opportunities to streamline processes   Continuous Improvement: Implement process improvement initiatives, such as Lean and Six Sigma methodologies, to enhance efficiency, reduce waste, and improve overall productivity   Reporting: Prepare and present regular reports on production and inventory performance, including key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics

column2: A Finance Accounts professional is responsible for managing the financial operations of a company or organization. The job duties of a Finance Accounts professional may include:   Maintaining accurate financial records, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, general ledger, and other financial statements.   Preparing and analyzing financial reports, such as balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.   Managing the budgeting and forecasting process to ensure that the company's financial goals are met.   Developing financial policies and procedures to ensure that the company complies with all relevant regulations and accounting standards.   Managing the company's tax and audit functions, including preparation of tax returns and coordination of external audits.   Developing financial models and conducting analysis to support strategic decision-making.   Managing the company's cash flow and liquidity, including forecasting and managing working capital requirements.A successful Finance Accounts professional should have strong financial and analytical skills, as well as excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

column2: Job Title: Procurement HeadOverview: We are seeking an experienced and strategic-minded Procurement Head to oversee all aspects of procurement activities within our organization. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership skills, extensive knowledge of procurement processes, and a proven track record of negotiating and managing supplier contracts. The Procurement Head will be responsible for developing and implementing procurement strategies to optimize costs, ensure timely delivery of goods and services, and maintain high quality standards across all procurement activities.Responsibilities:Strategy Development: Develop and implement procurement strategies aligned with the company's overall objectives and budgetary constraints.Supplier Management: Identify, evaluate, and select suppliers based on criteria such as price, quality, and reliability. Negotiate contracts and terms with suppliers to secure advantageous terms and conditions.Procurement Operations: Oversee the procurement process from requisition to delivery, ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures. Streamline procurement processes to improve efficiency and reduce costs.Vendor Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with key suppliers. Monitor supplier performance and address any issues or concerns promptly to ensure continuity of supply.Cost Optimization: Analyze market trends and pricing data to identify opportunities for cost savings. Implement cost-saving initiatives without compromising quality or service levels.Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks associated with procurement activities, such as supply chain disruptions, quality issues, or price fluctuations.Compliance: Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and company policies, such as procurement regulations, ethical sourcing practices, and sustainability initiatives.Team Leadership: Provide leadership and guidance to the procurement team. Foster a collaborative and supportive work environment conducive to professional growth and development.Reporting and Analysis: Prepare regular reports and analysis on procurement performance, including key metrics such as cost savings, supplier performance, and inventory levels.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.Proven experience in procurement leadership roles, with a minimum of 8 years in a similar capacity.Strong knowledge of procurement processes, including sourcing, contract negotiation, and supplier management.Excellent negotiation and communication skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external suppliers.Solid understanding of market dynamics and industry trends in procurement.Proficiency in procurement software and tools, such as ERP systems, e-procurement platforms, and data analytics tools.Demonstrated leadership abilities, with a track record of leading and developing high-performing teams.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.Certification in procurement or supply chain management (e.g., CSCP, CPSM, CIPS) preferred.Location: Perungudi, Chennai

Proven SAP S/4 Hana on premise experience is required.      3 full lifecycle SAP roll out deployments experience is required. SAP ABAP basic knowledge, reading of ABAP code, debugging experience is a plus.
