column2: In this role as lead Software Development Engineer in Test (SDE/T) III, you drive the testing of Medtronic s core internal software services, from its DevSecOps frameworks and automated pipelines to its FDA regulated and full-stack monitoring services    You and your team will be responsible for testing a diverse set of frameworks, applications, and services   Your team will build and develop our end-to-end automated test harness that tests, deploys, and runs our internally developed Kubernetes and DevSecOps framework   We have some rudimentary testing frameworks built using opensource products and AWS services, but these need significant design and product enhancements to function at the scale are quality we need   And finally, you and your team will provide mentorship to our client software development engineers and scientists who use our frameworks      A Day in the Life                    Team Lead for a team of software development engineers in test (SDE/T) providing mentorship and leadership as together you work to create a new test-driven culture and team identity                Lead our testing practices and improve the testing frameworks around unit, CI, load, and performance testing capabilities against the full CI/CD, Kubernetes, and migration pipelines                Develop new automated test services to ensure our full-stack monitoring service works with both custom and COTS applications                Test end-to-end CI/CD use cases, understanding our diverse user community configurations, use cases, and environments                Work with other test engineers at Medtronic and help lead and evolve the best testing practices across our scientific and client teams                Be an integral member of the core DevSecOps/Shared Services development team and help develop, test, deploy, and operate our services 24x7x365 globally      Must Have: Minimum Requirements      Doctorate degree       OR      Master s degree and 1-3 years of related experience      OR      Bachelor s degree and 4-6 years of related experience      OR      Associate degree and 7-10 years of related experience      OR      High School Diploma and 10+ years of related experience      Nice to Have         A degree in computer science or related field      Proven experience testing in an agile, TDD driven development environment using automated unit, acceptance, CI, and system testing shipping commercial software through at least one development lifecycle      1-2 years leading and running software test teams. Successful experience recruiting and hiring top talent.      Proficient using two or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: Java, C, C++, Swift/Objective C, Python, Go, C#, or JavaScript      Experience doing full stack testing including infrastructure cloud services (Storage, VMs, Network, etc) as well as application and user experience in a continuous CI/CD pipeline environment      Experience using and testing containerized/Kubernetes clusters and associated pipelines, management, and operations      Experience crafting, building, and running automated test frameworks in distributed cloud environments such as AWS and GCP      Experience testing in an automated and programmatic DevSecOps environment      Experience using industry standard test tools, frameworks, and environments      Familiarity testing serverless computing and microservice functions a plus      Experience working in a medical regulated environment considered a plus

column2: At our Sanofi we are leveraging analytics and technology, on behalf of patients around the world. We are seeking those who have a passion for using data, analytics, and insights to drive decision making that will allow us to tackle some of the world s greatest health threats.    Within our commercial Insights, Analytics, and Data organization we are transforming to better power decision-making across our end-to-end commercialization process, from business development to late lifecycle management.    Deliverables support planning and decision making across multiple functional areas such as finance, manufacturing, product development and commercial.    In addition to ensuring high-quality deliverables, our team drives synergies across the franchise, fosters innovation and best practices, and creates solutions to bring speed, scale and shareability to our planning processes. As we endeavour, we are seeking a dynamic talent for the role of   Senior Analyst - Advanced Analytics    We are looking for a team member to support our analytics team based out of US. Robust analytics is a priority for our businesses, as the product potential has major implications to a wide range of disciplines.    It is essential to have someone who understands and aspires to implement innovative analytics techniques to drive our insights generation across different franchises.    The core of the role is to be a trusted business partner having deep data mining expertise and a strong advanced analytical skill set.    The role will partner with the GBU Business Transformation team to support with advanced data analysis, Model building, Promo-Mix modelling, Insights, generating reports, and presenting the insights or output to senior Leadership    ?    People  :   Maintain effective relationship with the end stakeholders within the allocated GBU and tasks - with an end objective to develop education and communication content as per requirement   Actively lead and develop SGH operations associates and ensure new technologies are leveraged   Initiate the contracting process and related documents within defined timelines; and   Collaborate with global stakeholders for project planning and setting up the timelines and maintaining budget    Performance indicators  :   Hands on modelling in support of GenMed, Specialty Care, CHC, Pasteur resource allocation work   Evaluates the effectiveness of various promotion and marketing programs leveraging secondary data sources   Marketing mix model / Promotion response model / ROI analysis   Impact of channel dynamics: Field Force/Multi-Channel Modelling (New Commercial Model)   Optimizes promotion resource allocation   Scenario-Based Simulation   Other analyses include customer segmentation, market performance analysis/trend Break detection, pricing analysis, web-analytic tools   Develops new methodologies/software solutions   Creates, maintains, updates, and evolves Marketing Mix Models Globally   Responsible for consistent metrics as inputs and outputs of the models   Quantitative Strategy Consultant partner with a broad range of internal cross-BU client teams across regions to deliver and advise seamless solutions across the most specific marketing and sales issues facing a client   Engage with lead Global Service Hub lead to formulate and apply state-of-the-art management science approaches (Resource Allocation) to define the need from the clients   Integrate output from the Global Analytic CoE to support Regional Strategy issues working with the Global Service Hub lead   Subject Matter Expert in Marketing Mix implementation   Strong healthcare industry knowledge and experience   Ability to assimilate multiple sources of information into actionable insight for business issues   Strong working knowledge of relevant data sources and ability to search for new and informative sources.    Weightage  : 20%    Performance  :   Refresh Existing Reports and identifies improvement opportunities in reporting and BI tools and as needed structure / functionality with the latest insights as they become available   Create dashboards to synthesize and visualize key information and enable business decisions   Works to develop deal tracking analytics and reporting capabilities   Collaborates with Digital to enhance data access across various sources, develop tools, technology, and process to constantly improve quality and productivity   Contribute to evolving our offerings and improving efficiency of repeated /routine processes through standardization/ automation of various offerings, models, and processes   Proactively conduct rationalization of reports to avoid data redundancies and free up capacity to work on new initiatives/projects   Synthesis of data and insights by collaborating/gathering inputs from colleagues in other functions such as BI, Data Management, Market Research, Commercial/Business Excellence, Marketing, Strategy, Finance and BD groups   Provide quarterly utilization metrics of reports produced via usage metrics available in Power BI or other methods for reports outside of BI framework   Assist development and maintenance of KPI reports for the commercial team, covering Marketing and other related functions, and access appropriate information via a variety of tools and sources   Create dashboards to synthesize and visualize key information and enable business decisions   Develop a deep understanding of internal customers data and analytical needs focusing on the customer-facing model   Monitor the external environment to stay up to date on the latest therapeutic area research and clinical development, as well as competitor landscape, and summarize and present findings through various communication channels   Capability in applying deeper technical skills and knowledge that is shared across the functional area (eg, deep knowledge of key data sets, modelling capabilities, etc)   Develop models (demand and patient, promo mix etcs) using key business insights from various market to support commercial excellence   Frame the key marketing and sales issues to guide the team s analysis and work plan   Lead marketing and sales-related problem-solving activities, leveraging output from other Global Analytic CoE Sub-Teams   Work with Global Service Hub lead and/or quantitative modelers to synthesize input from various analyses into specific and actionable business recommendations   Support Regional Sales and Marketing Strategy and BD/CD by integrating Sub-Team modelling efforts with business issues   Develop, in collaboration with other Global Analytics CoE and Global Service Hub Lead, original marketing concepts, points of view, and problem-solving tools, frameworks, and approaches   Execute several Analytic projects concurrently   Prepare high-quality, accurate analysis using cutting-edge analytical methods   Communicate model results and Implications to business partners   Develop Resource Allocation tools and Advance Analytic process automation   Support predictive modelling projects (eg, MCM/Digital Marketing Analytics)   ?    Performance indicators  : Adherence to timeline, quality target    Weightage  : 50%    Process  :   Support delivery of projects in terms of resourcing, coordination, quality, timeliness, efficiency, and high technical standards for deliveries made by the medical/ field writing group, including scientific documents and clinical/medical reports   Contribute to overall quality enhancement by ensuring high scientific standards for the output produced by the medical/ field writing group; and   Secure adherence to compliance procedures and internal/operational risk controls in accordance with all applicable standards   Refresh report on frequency/cycle basis (weekly / monthly / quarterly / annually) ,  along with QC checks for each refresh   Use latest tools / technologies / methodologies and partner with internal teams to provide support on all sort of regular and adhoc business analytics activities like build, maintenance, and enhancements of such systems   Ability to work cross-functionally, gather requirements, analyse data, and generate insights and reports that can be used by the GBU   Work collaboratively with the stakeholder teams to prioritize work and deliver on time-sensitive requests   Be able to provide and defend gathered intelligence, methodology, content, and conclusions to the global leadership in a clear, concise format    Performance indicators  : Feedback from stakeholders on satisfaction with deliverables Adherence to plan/calendar    Weightage  : 25%   ?    Stakeholder  : Work closely with the Business Transformation Team to prioritize work and deliver on time-sensitive requests    Performance indicators:   Feedback from stakeholders (end customers, other teams) on satisfaction with services provided    Weightage:   5%   ?   ?   About you   ?    Experience  :   4+ years of experience in a Pharma and/or CPG Data Science/Management Science setting.   Heavy Quantitative Analysis - State-of-the-Art Quantitative Skills   Economics Background a plus (i.e., Phd preferred)   Niche Modeling Consulting Background   Experience in Pharma Sales and Marketing Strategy Modeling   Advanced Econometric/Statistical modeling skills   Experience with SAS programming   Proficient in R and/or Python programming   Strong work ethic   Ability to work under pressure   Manage project, work with statistical consultants   Interact with quantitative business analysts   Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques.   People management experience by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training associates; conflicts or complaints resolving ability from stakeholders and associates.   Supervising project activities and ensuring it is properly provisioned and staffed.    Soft skills  : Strong learning agility; Ability to manage ambiguous environments, and to adapt to changing needs of the business; Good interpersonal and communication skills; strong presentation skills a must; Team player who is curious, dynamic, result oriented and can work collaboratively; Ability to think strategically in an ambiguous environment; Ability to operate effectively in an international matrix environment, with ability to work across time zones; Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques     Technical skills  :   Proactive and self-motivated   Manage ambiguity   Challenge conventional wisdom   Broad and deep understanding of Pharma Sales and Marketing   In depth knowledge of multiple therapeutic categories   Experience in Management Science (Marketing Mix, Promotion Response, Segmentation/Predictive Analytics, Forecasting) in a pharmaceutical company, consulting   Proficient of programming languages (eg SQL, SAS, Python, R, VBA)   Experience using analytical platforms (eg Databricks, Jupyter Notebook, SQL developers, SPSS, SAS, CART/machine learning, Access etc)    Proficient with pharmaceutical and commercial data sources and/or CRM data systems (eg IQVIA, Symphony, Komodo, Veeva, Salesforce)    Experience of using analytical tools like Power BI, Qliksense, Tableau, Smartsheet, and Alteryx etc;    Expert knowledge of Excel and proficiency in VBA    Experience of developing and managing dashboards    Project management abilities; capable of prioritizing and handling multiple projects simultaneously    An aptitude for problem solving and strategic thinking and ensuring high quality data output with strong quality assurance    Ability to synthesize complex information into clear and actionable insights    Proven ability to work effectively across all levels of stakeholders and diverse functions    Solid understanding of pharmaceutical development, manufacturing, supply chain and marketing functions    Demonstrated leadership and management in driving innovation and automation leveraging advanced statistical and analytical techniques     Education  : Advanced degree in areas such as Finance / Management / Statistics / Decision Sciences/Engineering/Life Sciences/ Business Analytics or related field (eg, PhD / MBA / Masters)     Languages  : Excellent knowledge in English and strong communication skills - written and spoken

column2: You are a dynamic data scientist interested in challenging the status quo to ensure development and impact of Sanofis AI solutions for the patients of tomorrow   You are an influencer and leader who has deployed AI/ML and optimization solutions applying state-of-the art algorithms with technically robust lifecycle management   You have a keen eye for improvement opportunities and a demonstrated ability to deliver AI/ML and optimization solutions while working across different technologies and in a cross-functional environment          Our vision for digital, data analytics and AI      Join us on our journey in enabling Sanofi s Digital Transformation through becoming an AI-first organization.     This means:          AI Factory - Versatile Teams Operating in Cross Functional Pods:   Utilizing digital and data resources to develop AI products, bringing data management, AI and product development skills to products, programs and projects to create an agile, fulfilling and meaningful work environment.       Leading Edge Tech Stack:   Experience build products that will be deployed globally on a leading-edge tech stack.       World Class Mentorship and Training:   Working with renowned leaders and academics in machine learning to further develop your skillsets            There are multiple vacancies for this role at various levels and seniority. Further assessments will be completed to determine specific function and level of hired candidates.             Job Highlights:         Apply data science expertise in machine learning, statistics, text-mining/NLP, forecasting and optimization to multiple analytics projects.      Build models, algorithms, and simulations by writing highly optimized code and using state-of-the art machine learning technologies.            Work with developers, engineers, and MLOps to deliver production-ready AI/ML solutions.             Key Functional Requirements & Qualifications:        Hands-on AI/ML modeling experience of complex datasets combined with strong understanding of theoretical foundations of AI/ML.      Expertise within most of the following areas: supervised learning, unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, federated learning, time series forecasting, Bayesian statistics, optimization           Experience developing deployable code and deploying models in product-focused development under an agile environment      Comfortable working in cloud and high-performance computing environments (eg AWS, GCP, Databricks, Apache Spark)      Experience in production-ready software development      Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, data visualization and data storytelling skills      A demonstrated ability to work and collaborate in a team environment         Nice to have:      Experience in writing optimization models (linear programming, mixed-integer programming, etc) using Python or other programming languages.      Experience developing optimization models using open-source packages (Pyomo, PuLP etc) or optimization solvers (Gurobi, CPLEX etc), or Supply Chain Guru, etc      Experience in life sciences and healthcare and experience in a complex global organization                  Key Technical Requirements & Qualifications:        PhD in mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, statistics, economics, operation research or a related quantitative discipline with strong coding skills and 2+ years of hands-on data science/analytics experience, OR masters Degree in relevant domain with 6+ years of data science/analytics experience      Expertise with core data science languages (such as Python, R, Scala), and familiarity with different database systems (eg SQL, NoSQL)      Disciplined AI/ML development (CI/CD, Orchestration)            Knowledge of Tableau, Power BI, Plotly or similar      Experience with various enterprise-level Application Programming Interfaces (APIs)             Preferred qualifications:        Experience working in the Tech industry or technology consulting           Experience in pharmaceutical or industrial industries

column1: Senior Principal IT Technologist - SAP Finance
column2: As an SAP Accounts Payable IT Technical Analyst, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing the SAP system to support Accounts Payable operations including several upstream and downstream processes    Your role in the SAP AP & EEM (Concur) IT Team involves working with the Sourcing, Accounts Payable, EEM and Treasury business and the AP (SAP, ReadSoft), EEM (Concur) and Kofax IT Support teams to conduct the following duties; Configuring and maintaining SAP Accounts Payable and Employee Expense Management (Concur) applications to meet Medtronic functional requirements (policy workflows, integrating with upstream processes of procurement, travel, event management, expenses, services, contracted services and contingent sourcing as well as with downstream processes related to integrations with banks or check management)    This individual would be responsible to configure systems for accounts payable invoice processing, ensuring 2-way and 3-way matching, workflow for non-PO based invoices, payment approvals, check and bank payments, based on payment policies and terms, manual and automated bank integrations and cash management, SOX Compliance and risk management   You will conduct the Concur Admin role liaising with SAP Concur for support and reporting requests, provision Concur user access, conduct Concur configuration to meet country allowances and develop Concur (Cognos) reports to meet business requirements   You would also be supporting current and future Accounts Payable solutions for electronic invoicing and invoice verification, invoice scanning (Kofax) and bank payment processes and other process optimizations (Dynamic Discounting and Supply Chain Finance)   You will act as a liaison between the sourcing, accounts payable and IT departments, ensuring that the SAP system aligns with the organizations Accounts Payable goals and policies   This position is expected to engage with the business and analyse and delineate requirements, draft and review function specifications, configure SAP and Concur systems for the AP & EEM functional areas, engage with development teams, plan and execute testing and eventually deploy and support the functionality in production     A Day in the Life         o         Manage, architect and support SAP BW4 HANA, SAP S4 and SAP HANA database, ensuring high availability and performance.        o         Develop, Implement, and maintain SAP BW/4 HANA and SAP HANA solutions, taking a leading role on Enterprise Operational Data reporting projects.        o         Monitor and implement SLT / Smart Data Integration for HANA to facilitate data integration and synchronization.        o         Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and document functional requirements.        o         Lead and support SAP projects from planning and design to implementation and maintenance.        o         Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues and provide on-call support as needed.        o         Leveraging cross functional knowledge as required (OS, Networking, ABAP, etc.) to identify and debug issues quickly.        o         Ensure data security, system stability, and regulatory compliance for SAP BW/4 HANA systems.        o         Stay up to date with SAP best practices and technology trends.         Must Have: Minimum Requirements             Bachelor s degree              14+ years of experience with a bachelor s degree and 8+ years of S/4 experience with an advanced degree      Nice to Have              Previous Medtronic experience              Extensive experience in SAP projects, with a focus on end-to-end development, SAP BW/4 HANA, SAP S/4 HANA, SAP HANA database, SAP ECC.              Expertise in Smart Data Integration for HANA.              Experience integrating SAP / Non-SAP ERP platforms with SAP BW/4 HANA and upstream/downstream systems (including API Development)              Strong cross-functional knowledge on HANA Database, SAP Functional (esp. Finance and Sales), and other SAP technologies and able to translate those skills into technical solutions for issue resolution.              Deep understanding of ABAP skills is required.              Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.              Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.              Proven ability to work independently and in a team.              Prior Pharma and/or Medical Device experience

At least 3 to 5years of business consultancy and SAP implementation experience in an international environment specifically in areas of Logistic    Logistics Execution LE (mandatory)    2yrs minimum Experience in interfacing SAP ECC with third party logistics providers (3PL) who may have their own warehouse management / warehouse control systems     The ability to fluently read, write, understand and communicate in English.

column1: Senior Therapy Development Specialist/ Area Manager- Structural Heart
column2: Senior TDS will play a critical role in Therapy development for Medtronic TAVR therapy in India subcontinent through ensure safe adoption and growth of the Medtronic TAVI Systems and future catheter-based therapy technologies. Senior TDS will be mentored and trained by our Therapy Training manager and fully trained TDSs for a period of      6 Months        where they are expected to develop technical and clinical expertise to provide support for therapy delivery.       KEY RESPONSIBILITIES       1.    Senior TDSs are expected to go through intensive technical training on Medtronic TVAR Therapy and finish all certifications (BP-1, BP-2 and BP-3 for both imaging and procedure) over a period of next one year. This training will be facilitated by Training manager and Mentor and Senior TDS is expected to shadow him/her. Objective of this training is to    Develop and maintain comprehensive clinical and technical product knowledge.      2.    Senior TDS will be responsible for executing administrative tasks assigned by Mentor but not limited to below list.        Responsible for product inventory to include shipments, usage and return of product.      Support event planning and proctor logistics.      Report device complaints to proper departments within quality assurance      Schedules travel arrangements to ensure multiple objectives are accomplished.      Supports heart teams with appropriate products, clinical literature and pre case planning      Maintain hospital eligibility/access with various vendor credentialing services if applicable        3.      Senior TDSs are expected to execute following training and education market development activities: -      o      Education and training activities including coordination and set up procedure simulators, facilitation of simulated TAVI procedures and procedural troubleshooting and coordination of staff in services      o      Educate/Train hospital staff with proper valve loading instruction      o      Organizing CME s and other marketing activities      o      Organizing observer ship programs in existing COEs            4.      Establishing long-term medical-scientific/strategic relationships with Key Opinion Leaders (KOL s) and with related major medical associations and academic Centers of Excellence (COE s)          5.      Timely reporting of weekly reports and trackers.    Take initiative and be a self-starter.       6     .      Achieve AOP in assigned Territory      7.      Drive KOL engagement activities in assigned territory       JOB REQUIRMENTS:           Engineering/ science graduates or Clinical designation (RN, Radiology technician, Scrub Tech, Physician Assistant, perfusionist, Cath lab technicians.          Position requires excellent written and verbal communication skills to communicate effectively with key stakeholders (Colleagues, supervisors, healthcare practitioners).          Strong learning agility and problem-solving skills and organizing and prioritizing work          Tenacity to stay the course despite setbacks          Demonstrates integrity and recognized as a role model by their peers and manager.          Clinical selling aptitude with strong interpersonal and presentation skills.            Strong relations with leading Cardiologists in respective territory / existing market        PHYSICAL JOB REQUIRMENTS:      1.      The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.      2.      While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer and communicate with peers and co-workers.      3.      Extended periods of time doing computer-based work and Able to lift 20 pounds.      4.      Ability to use computers and CT reconstruction programs.      5.      Ability to travel 75% of the time by car train and plane including weekends as weekends are spent in case support or programs.      6.      Wear lead apron for long periods of time (2-3 hours on average).      7.      Ability to work in Cath Labs or ORs with radiation exposure.      8.      Ability to conduct company business outside of the typical Monday through Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm, work-schedule.       Environmental Exposure       1.      Infectious disease; Radiation; Blood borne pathogens      2.      Must be able to wear all required personal protective equipment (PPE)       SKILLS/COMPETENCIES (What we are looking for in you)         Leadership expectations          Possesses Business Acumen drive sales in today s competitive environment. column2: Biological E Limited is looking for Executive / Sr. Executive to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.    Executive:An "Executive" is typically a mid-level position within an organization    Executives are responsible for specific tasks, projects, or functions within their department or area of expertise    They often report to higher-level managers or directors and may supervise more junior staff members    The role of an Executive can vary widely depending on the organization, and it may encompass areas such as finance, marketing, operations, or human resources, among others    Senior Executive:A "Senior Executive" holds a higher-level position within an organization compared to a standard Executive    Senior Executives typically have more experience, greater responsibility, and more significant decision-making authority    They may lead larger teams, manage more complex projects, and play a key role in shaping the strategies and policies of their department or division    Senior Executives often have a deeper understanding of their area of expertise and contribute to the development of the organization's goals and objectives

column2: As ADVANZ PHARMA continues to strengthen its position as the partner of choice for specialty, hospital, and rare disease medicines, we have an exciting opportunity for a   Senior Manager Supply Planning.   For your designated group of contract manufacturing organisations (CMOs) and portfolio of SKUs you will manage the planning, procurement, and supply of product to ensure agreed stock levels are maintained to support the revenue targets. You are accountable for the performance of your CMOs and the availability of product. You should work with the CMOs to ensure high levels of OTIF deliveries, efficient supply plans and to identify opportunities from continuous improvement.            What You ll Do:               Inventory Policy-                Help shape the inventory policy for your portfolio and seek to optimise the working capital associated with them.               Periodically review the suitability of the policy and make recommendations for changes.               Put in place supply plans that maintain compliance with the agreed inventory policy.                Supply Planning-                Using the consensus demand forecast, prepare supply plans for each CMO in accordance with the requirements of the manufacturing and supply agreements.               Share the forecasts with the CMOs and discuss with them their ability to support the forecast in short, mid and long term.               Raise and submit purchase orders.               Pursue CMO commitment to the purchase orders.               Maintain the companies ERP and other systems such that supply dates and volumes always reflect the CMOs commitment.               Regular interaction with CMO to ensure anticipated deliveries will be in accordance with the POs.               Cooperate with Distribution and Logistics function for the collection and delivery of your product from the CMO to the Distributor.               Raise & Manage issues and support respective team in resolving system related issues.               Ensure to capture key parameters for planning requirement like batch size, Lead time, etc. and update the Master data on regular basis.                Monitoring performance of the suppliers-                Developing & implementing vendor performance metrics.               Tracking vendor deliverables & service level agreements, Drive improvement in the OTIF performance.          Hold periodic business review meetings with your CMOs, sometimes in conjunction with other company business functions, to discuss:          Past period OTIF               Latest forecast and implications for CMO capacity               Opportunities to develop more efficient supply plans (OQs, campaigning, frequency of orders, mix of SKUs ordered together etc..) leading to improved supply performance and reduced cost.               Address the causes of supply delay both internally and externally.               Work with cross functional teams to ensure that product is promptly made available for sale upon delivery at the Distributors.               Helps optimize the supply chain and ensure compliance.                About You                We are looking for highly motivated individuals who are passionate about making a meaningful difference to patients lives.              For this role, you will also have the following:               Qualifications:             Graduate with Pharma/science background in     relevant subject or equivalent in experience.               Master s degree in business management is preferred.           Knowledge, Skills & Experience:           Must have significant experience in Supply & inventory planning of a pharmaceutical/Chemical manufacturing company.           Able to facilitate and drive results in a fast paced and demanding growth environment, leveraging strong interpersonal and leadership skills.           Ability to lead, contribute, decision making and influence others in a team-based organization.           Excellent people skills, project management skills, with an ability to openly convey information to team members in a timely, concise manner.           Ability to work with different Global culture and different time zones.           Solid business acumen accompanied by interpersonal skills.            Have a bias for action and fast decision making.           Ability to build and maintain strong business relationships internally & externally.           Willingness to travel internationally (especially within Europe)           Experience in supply chain technology/ processes such as SAP and modern software systems           Excellent communication skills. Ability to communicate clearly and concisely and use strong writing and verbal skills to communicate facts, figures, and ideas to others.            A positive and can-do approach   , biased towards finding solutions and embracing change.             Inspired by our values of entrepreneurship, speed and integrity.             Learning agility and scalability , with a desire to continuously improve and develop as ADVANZ grows.             Work collaboratively across all business functions with an open, honest, and respectful cooperation.             Ability to have fun and thrive in a growing, unique, and inclusive work environment.

column2: This role is a member of the       Contract Center of Excellence team within the Supply Management Solutions team of Medtronic s Global Supply Management Group        It reports to the Sr   Manager, Supply Management Solutions and will be exposed to a wide variety of contracting        activities for many commodities and services supporting         Medtronic strategic purchasing      A Day in the Life      Provides contract management support to assigned categories within Supply Management; includes drafting contracts on standard templates, reviewing supplier red-lines with legal team to ensure they meet guidelines, routing final contracts for signatures and ensuring contracts are correctly archived in the Ariba Contract Management System.         Communicates status of contract requests with internal stakeholders and works to meet business objectives and timelines with a service mindset.    Mitigates risk, leverages technology and purchase power, improves processes and systems, and reduces overall cost of ownership and acquisition.   SPECIALIST CAREER STREAM: Typically, an individual contributor with responsibility in a professional discipline or specialty. Delivers and/or manages projects assigned and works with other stakeholders to achieve desired results.     May act as a mentor to colleagues or may direct the work of other lower-level professionals.     The majority of time is spent delivering and overseeing the projects from design to implementation - while and adhering to policies, using specialized knowledge and skills normally acquired through advanced education    DIFFERENTIATING FACTORS     Autonomy: Established and productive individual contributor.         Leads by example and influences stakeholders toward adherence to global programs and standards.         Being part of a new team, a start-up, can-do mentality is a must.   Successful candidates will be self-starting and highly coachable with the ability to absorb and adopt new applications and systems.     Works independently with general supervision on larger, moderately complex projects / assignments.    Organizational Impact: Sets objectives for own job area to meet the objectives of projects and assignments.    Contributes to the completion of project milestones.    May have some involvement in cross-functional assignments.    Innovation and Complexity: Problems and issues faced are general and may require understanding of broader set of issues or other job areas but typically are not complex.    Makes adjustments or recommends enhancements in systems and processes to solve problems or improve effectiveness of job area.    Communication and Influence: Communicates primarily and frequently with internal as well as supplier contacts; External interactions are less complex or problem solving in nature.    Contacts others proactively to share information, status, needs and issues in order to inform, gain input, and translate business requirements into supplier-facing content in support of quality-based decision making. Nice to Have      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills      Outstanding attention to detail         Experience working with briefing and workflow management tools such as Workfront        Customer focused with exceptional follow through and accountability      Good organisation and time management skills, including working independently and unsupervised, able to prioritise and handle multiple tasks

column2: At our Sanofi we are leveraging analytics and technology, on behalf of patients around the world. We are seeking those who have a passion for using data, analytics, and insights to drive decision making that will allow us to tackle some of the world s greatest health threats.    Within our commercial Insights, Analytics, and Data organization we are transforming to better power decision-making across our end-to-end commercialization process, from business development to late lifecycle management.    Deliverables support planning and decision making across multiple functional areas such as finance, manufacturing, product development and commercial.    In addition to ensuring high-quality deliverables, our team drives synergies across the franchise, fosters innovation and best practices, and creates solutions to bring speed, scale and shareability to our planning processes. As we endeavour, we are seeking a dynamic talent for the role of   Senior Analyst    We are looking for a team member to support our analytics team based out of US. Robust analytics is a priority for our businesses, as the product potential has major implications to a wide range of disciplines.    It is essential to have someone who understands and aspires to implement innovative analytics techniques to drive our insights generation across GBU. develop SGH operations associates and ensure new technologies are leveraged   Initiate the contracting process and related documents within defined timelines; and   Collaborate with global stakeholders for project planning and setting up the timelines and maintaining budget    Performance indicators:   Feedback from (end stakeholders) on overall satisfaction    Weightage:   20% data access across various sources, develop tools, technology, and process to constantly improve quality and productivity   Will assist in managing medical Omnichannel plans in project management writing group, including scientific documents and clinical/medical reports   Contribute to overall quality enhancement by ensuring high scientific standards for the output produced by the medical column2: The Sr IT Technologist (Data Engineer) role is responsible for delivering data architecture solutions aligned with business capability needs and enterprise standards. This role works with D&A Solution Architects, Business Solution Architects and Technical Architects and external service providers to ensure data and information models and technologies align with stated architecture strategies and Medtronic s standards and delivery capabilities. In a delivery capacity, this role will work with Business Analysts to review and complete business capability needs, definitions, and requirements, data analysis, data modeling, technical specification writing, and working with development organizations to ensure designs are delivered.     A DAY IN THE LIFE     Coordinate data model, flow, and technology aspects of solution architecture design, implementation, and modification activities across projects, teams and key process and technology leaders.  Ensure all data architecture aspects of solution design and analysis work within the Architecture Definition Document is documented and included in the architecture repositories. Generate Solution Architecture, Data Model, and ETL specifications to match business outcome requirements.  Consult with business and technology (application, infrastructure) development projects to fit systems and desired information outcomes to business capability needs, identify when it is necessary to modify the solution architecture to accommodate project needs.  Partner with Business Solution Architects and Analysts and Data Modelers on requirements gathering or clarification and ensure alignment to desired business outcomes.  Works with and advises stakeholders, project teams, and peers in areas assigned on project needs and design.  Estimate work effort for development and enhancement requests supporting individual projects and broader team and enterprise strategies.  Understand and use standard tools, processes, designs, and methodologies for project management, documentation, system development, and implementation.  Actively support the architecture process, its outcome and ongoing results to senior leadership across Medtronic business and technology globally.  Ensure adherence to the defined IT governance activities associated with the Solution Selection Policy & Procedure (i.e., architecture boards, governance councils).  Partner with the Enterprise Project Management Office (EPMO) to ensure alignment and execution of plans with project deliveries.  Ensure Medtronics systems and information are protected in accordance with Medtronics Information Protection Policies and Standards, as well as best Information Protection practices.       BASIC QUALIFICATIONS     You are a hands-on, pro-active professional who can keep oversight of complex processes   Future target end state is Snowflake, but you at least have experience with Oracle databases, data warehouses, data modelling, ETL and BI   You have experience with SQL, e.g. you are able to develop new ETL procedures and fine-tune existing SQL code for efficiency and maintenance reasons   SAP data structure/tables and/or functional knowledge   You are flexible and pragmatic, problem solving mindset   You have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision required   You are a team player   Excellent English communication skills (verbal & written), Dutch is a plus   Experience with Agile/Scrum is a plus   Experience in the Supply Chain area is a plus    EDUCATION REQUIREMENT:   Bachelor s Degree     YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:   5+ years of IT experience with Master s degree     SPECIALIZED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:    5+ years of experience aligned to a relevant architecture discipline (data engineering, analytics development)  3+ years of experience with cloud-based solutions (e.g., applications (SaaS), platforms (PaaS), and infrastructure (IaaS)) within an Enterprise environment  Oracle, PL/SQL, Snowflake, SAP BW  Git Concepts  Informatica Cloud Integration Services (IICS)      DESIRED/PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS    NICE TO HAVE (Preferred Qualifications)    5+ years of experience working with large enterprise systems & solutions  Excellent leadership and teamwork skills  Strong analytical and critical thinking skills  Strong collaboration and influencing skills  Broad knowledge of data analysis/database design technologies/tools in an operational environment  Strong technical acumen, decision making, and influence skills across all levels of an organization  Strong communication skills, including with employees, clients, senior management and vendors  Solid presentation skills, including the ability to translate data concepts and technical information into business terms (e.g., ability to explain complex technical solutions and architecture strategies to non-technical resources)   Strong results orientation (driving to deadlines, financial targets, project goals, etc.)  Ability to work collaboratively and partner with employees, leaders, clients, and vendors  Demonstrated ability to work in a global, virtual organization  Work experience in the Medical Device Industry, or other regulated industry  Ability to mentor and develop business, architecture, and technical resources  Able to work independently as well as cooperatively.

column2: At Illumina, we are expanding access to genomic technology to realize health equity for billions of people around the world. Our efforts enable life-changing discoveries that are transforming human health through the early detection and diagnosis of diseases and new treatment options for patients.    Working at Illumina means being part of something bigger than yourself. Every person, in every role, has the opportunity to make a difference. Surrounded by extraordinary people, inspiring leaders, and world changing projects, you will do more and become more than you ever thought possible      Responsibilities       Primarily work on Global available to promise module in SAP APO (Advance planning and optimization) planning system.      Ensure all requirements could be tracked, installed, tested, verified, and/or uninstalled or backed out, if needed. Follow Illumina testing methodology using ValGenesis application.      Solid understanding of SDLC as well as expert knowledge of both agile and traditional project management principles      Lead end-to-end deployment, testing, security testing, and adherence to quality compliance and risk management      Manage business users across various planning processes like demand planning, supply planning, distribution planning and order management      Work with regional business users and align their requirements with Global processes      Coordinate transition from development, testing and production environments, ensuring appropriate change tickets are created in ServiceNow, approved, and processed to meet deadlines      Lead and co-ordinate the Go-Live activities including the execution of the deployment Plans and checklists      Manage relationships and coordinate work between different teams (internal as well as external partnering team) across different locations.      Coordinate regional business requirements with Global business team in San Diego       All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional tasks and responsibilities.        Skills required       Strong SAP APO GATP experience with working knowledge in APO SNP      Minimum 6-8+yrs experience in hands-on configuration / support of SCM APO-GATP      Experience of minimum 2 end to end GATP implementation projects      Strong knowledge of various GATP functionalities like Rules based ATP, Backorder processing, product allocation      Knowledge of STO availability check process.      Knowledge of sales BOM functionality in SAP ECC      Understanding of SAP SD ATP configuration required to enable GATP.      Experience in working on core interface (CIF). Creation, activation, and initial transfer of data from ECC to APO using CIF integration models.      Knowledge of advance ATP solution in SAP S4 Hana is added advantage      Business Process documentation      Strong communication skills       All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional tasks and responsibilities.

column2: The role is responsible for development, maintenance and support of the global Enterprise Manufacturing Execution Systems (EMES) solution that is utilized globally. Key role shall:      Scope:    Emerson Syncade core platform, components, interfaces, custom tools, and any customizations that support digital manufacturing systems and operations including:      Material and Inventory modules (MM)   Order management (OM)   Equipment and instrument integration (ET)   Behavior Editor(BE)   Document control and Archiving (DCA)   Recipe Authoring (RA)   Security & Audit (SA)   Resource Editor (RTE)     Key Responsibilities:      Engage with the BU business stakeholders, Development Team, Program team, users, and partners to understand requirements, deliver solutions, enhancements, Bug Fixes and resolution of issues    Lead the detail design and implementation activity for MES projects based on Emerson MES platform-- Syncade    Enables common processes across the sites such as Application recipe Behaviours, Global Components and Work Instructions, build/enhance a repository for common components   Share the responsibility for design and support of business solutions based on site s needs for MES processes and functions   Drive new releases & hot fixes technical assessments and related interoperability test with Syncade   Ensure project and/or validation documentation is maintained during lifecycle & release management   Find innovative ways to leverage Syncade to drive business value   Utilizes expertise in MES to provide the assistance in the ongoing implementation across World Areas, enhancements, Integrations, and support   Work closely with MES Product Owner to create and maintain a product backlog according to defined business value and/or ROI targets   Manages the risk and ensures prompt resolution of issues, removing roadblocks and impediments   Proactively manages communications within team and about project status and next steps   Work with Domain Architects (including Data, Infrastructure, Application and Security architects) to ensure that Functional Solution Design aligns with system design guidelines and enterprise architecture standards    Configuring MES setups on the applications and work on L1 (Machines, Sensors) to L2 (PLC s, SCADA), to L3 for MES/MOM, to L4 for ERP integrations (Be it Oracle EBS, SAP et cetera)   Work with Infrastructure, Security (DMZ for Plant and DMS for Office network separation), Various Protocols etc   Create and maintain Functional user manuals, Functional documentation, other project collaterals et cetera   Understand other tools related to MES system, Interface with related Edge applications, RFID, Scanner, Robots, Pick Systems, et cetera    Lead, design, implement, and test a full stack of Manufacturing Execution System (MES) technologies   Interface with related manufacturing systems such as Historian, SCADA, PLC, Robot, CNC, etc        Qualifications - required education, experience & skills:     Bachelor s degree in engineering, master s in computer applications (MCA).   Experience of having worked in Domain Industry, Complex Manufacturing environment.   4-6+ years of solid work experience and having worked as Functional Lead/Analyst in designing, building, deploying and supporting automation and manufacturing execution systems (Syncade/PASX/Rockwell Pharma Suite/Opcenter/Camstar, Delta V, PI Data historian, etc.) in regulated manufacturing environments.    OR   7+ years experience in the Life Sciences industry, with at least 3+ years experience in Emerson Syncade MES     Technical exposure to Emerson Syncade: Manufacturing Execution (or another MES) architecture     Strong knowledge of Smart Factory, Industry 4.0, Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT), and manufacturing process.     Strong knowledge of Automation layer (Scada, DCS, PLCs, industrial protocols).     Knowledge on OPC/MQTT/Modbus/Profibus.     Knowledge of and/or experience in adhering to ISA-95 model.     Understanding of S88 Standard & Batching solution.     Understand Technical pieces of Syncade and the alignment of behaviours, should be able to modify existing recipes.     Recipe Authoring - Ability to develop recipes from scratch will be an added advantage.    Experience with MES project development, deployment, integration.   Knowledge of business processes covered by a standard MES System, from Weighing & Dispensing to Master Batch Record and Review by Exception business processes.   Strong Knowledge of pharma industry regulatory context (GxP).   Knowledge of Solution architecture & integration.   Knowledge of Infrastructure technologies & services.   Knowledge of ERP (including integration with SAP) a plus .   At least 2 IT full-life cycle implementations acting in key Functional roles such IT project lead, cut-over lead, migration lead, etc. Experience in agile methodologies and JIRA/Servicenow/Confluence.   Knowledge on MES Systems and processes, understanding of the Architecture around.   Strong domain expertise in the application of IT to manufacturing, including a broad understanding of processes and how they are supported by IT tools and systems.   Strong knowledge of regulatory landscape and demonstrated experience with GAMP compliance and computer system validation.   Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to learn new technologies and adopt evolving business practices.   Ability to work across global sites and cultures.   Optional travel up to 5% domestically and internationally.

column2: Area Covering: Kolkata, Guwahati, Howrah, Baharampur, Siliguri, Imphal, Dibrugarh, Krishnanagar, Midnapur, Baharampur. Job Summary: As a Zonal Business Manager at Brinton Pharma, you will be responsible for overseeing and driving the sales and marketing activities within a designated geographical zone. Your primary objective will be to achieve the sales targets, enhance market share, and uphold the brand image of Brinton Pharma within the assigned zone. You will lead a team of Area Sales Managers and Medical Representatives, ensuring effective execution of sales strategies and implementation of promotional activities.Key Responsibilities:Develop and implement sales plans and strategies to achieve sales targets and objectives for the assigned zone.Lead, motivate, and mentor a team of Area Sales Managers and Medical Representatives to ensure optimal performance and productivity.Conduct regular performance reviews and provide feedback to the team members to enhance their skills and capabilities.Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences to identify opportunities for growth and expansion.Collaborate with the marketing department to develop promotional campaigns, product launches, and marketing initiatives tailored to the zone's requirements.Build and maintain strong relationships with key opinion leaders, healthcare professionals, distributors, and other stakeholders within the zone.Ensure adherence to compliance and regulatory guidelines in all sales and marketing activities within the zone.Prepare and present periodic reports on sales performance, market trends, and competitor analysis to the senior management.Coordinate with other departments such as supply chain, finance, and regulatory affairs to ensure seamless operations within the zone.Represent Brinton Pharma at industry events, conferences, and seminars to enhance brand visibility and network with potential clients.Qualifications and Skills:Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy, Business Administration, or related field. A Master's degree or MBA is preferred.Proven track record of successful sales management experience in the pharmaceutical industry, preferably in a managerial role.Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate teams towards achieving common goals.Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.Sound knowledge of pharmaceutical products, market dynamics, and regulatory requirements.Strategic thinker with analytical abilities to interpret sales data and market trends.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively. To Apply:Interested candidates should submit their resumes via email to amruta.jamdade@brintonhealth.com. Please include "Application for the Zonal Business Manager" in the subject line.

column2: You will be responsible for managing a designated sales territory or customer portfolio and building strong relationships with clients    Here are some key responsibilities associated with the role:Sales Target Achievement: Your primary objective is to meet or exceed sales targets set by the organization    You will develop sales strategies and tactics to maximize revenue from existing clients and acquire new customers within your assigned territory    Customer Relationship Management: You will build and maintain strong relationships with key customers, such as distributors, retailers, restaurants, or food service providers    This involves understanding their needs, providing product information and support, addressing any concerns or issues, and working towards long-term partnerships    Market Research and Analysis: You will conduct market research to identify potential customers, understand market trends, and stay updated on competitors' activities    This information will help you identify new sales opportunities, develop targeted marketing strategies, and position the organization's food products effectively    Sales Presentations and Product Demonstrations: You will deliver compelling sales presentations and product demonstrations to showcase the features, benefits, and value of the organization's food products    This may involve conducting tastings, providing samples, and highlighting unique selling points to generate customer interest and drive sales    Order Management and Sales Support: You will handle order management processes, including order placement, tracking, and fulfillment    You will coordinate with internal departments, such as logistics and operations, to ensure timely delivery of products and resolve any order-related issues    Additionally, you will provide sales support by addressing customer inquiries, providing product information, and offering after-sales assistance as needed    Sales Reporting and Analysis: You will maintain accurate and up-to-date sales records, including customer interactions, sales data, and revenue forecasts    You will prepare regular sales reports, analyze sales performance, identify trends, and provide insights to management to optimize sales strategies and improve outcomes    Product Knowledge and Training: You will stay updated on the organization's food products, including their ingredients, nutritional values, and usage instructions    You may also conduct product training sessions for customers and internal sales teams to ensure a thorough understanding of the products and their benefits
column13: Order management, Product training, Usage, Sales strategy, Market research, Management, Sales support, Logistics, CRM

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced   Product Owner - GSA SAP Logistics (WM/QM/PP)   to join our team   As a Subject Matter Expert (SME), you will play a vital role in providing expert guidance and support in the areas of SAP Logistics - Warehouse Management, Quality Management and Production Planning   The ideal candidate should possess a minimum of 8 years of business process knowledge and application expertise in SAP Logistics (WM/QM) including integration knowledge with SAP PP   You will be responsible for validating design and effort estimates, approving/rejecting change requests, reviewing and approving user requirements, design documents, and functional/technical specifications   Additionally, you will actively participate in key projects and assist in scoping for new demands while providing advisory support to the business on SAP solutions         Responsibilities:     Change Approval Board (CAB) and Design Authority Board (DAB):    Validate the design and effort estimates: Review and verify proposed design solutions and effort estimates to ensure alignment with organizational standards and requirements.   Approve/Reject Change Requests: Assess and make decisions on change requests based on feasibility, impact on existing systems, budget, and alignment with business objectives.         Projects:    Review and Approve Documentation: Thoroughly review and approve project documents, including user requirements, design documents, functional/technical specifications, ensuring adherence to standards and requirements.   Hands-on Participation for Key Projects: Actively contribute to key projects by providing expertise, guidance, troubleshooting, quality checks, and working on project deliverables.         Subject Matter Expertise:    Level 3 Support for AMS: Provide level 3 support for Application Management Services (AMS), resolving complex issues, investigating problems, and implementing solutions.   Participate in Critical/Major Incidents: Respond to critical or major incidents, utilizing expertise to analyse and promptly resolve incidents, minimizing business impact.         Scoping:    Help in Scoping for New Demand: Analyse business requirements, propose SAP solutions, collaborate with stakeholders, conduct feasibility assessments, and provide input on scope, timeline, and resources.   Advisory Role to Business on SAP Solution: Act as an advisor, offering guidance and recommendations on SAP solutions, leveraging expertise to provide insights into best practices, risks, and benefits.         Responsibilities will be adjusted based on the evolving needs of the organization.        About you    Experience     Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Equivalent work experience will also be considered.   Minimum of 8 years of experience in SAP WM/QM modules, with a strong focus on integration with PP module.   Experience in both project implementation and support roles, including full lifecycle implementations and post-go-live support.   Deep understanding of business processes in procurement, sales, inventory management, warehouse management, production planning, and quality management.   Strong knowledge of SAP configuration, customization, and enhancement techniques within the WM/QM/PP modules.   Demonstrated expertise in integrating SAP modules, specifically with PP and QM.   Experience in data migration, data conversion, and system interfaces within the SAP landscape.   Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve complex issues related to SAP Logistics.   Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.   Solid experience with service management principles, ITIL framework, and incident management processes.   Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and deliver high-quality results within tight deadlines.   Relevant SAP certifications (eg, SAP Certified Application Associate - Warehouse Management, Quality Management and/or Production Planning) are highly desirable.       Soft skills     Team player, service-oriented   Dynamic, results driven   Able to convince   Accountability and Reliability   Rigorous, autonomous       Technical skills     Expert for SAP WM/QM customization, writing specifications   Strong knowledge of enterprise structure design, master data, procurement, sales, distribution, warehouse, and product costing.   Strong cross-functional understanding with FI, CO, PP and QM   Familiarity with SAP technical skills such as basic programming concepts and debugging.   Strong oral and written communication skills.   Active listener with the ability to challenge requirements.   Analytical and synthetic, able to formalize solutions, and possesses good writing skills.       Languages     Fluent spoken and written English      When joining our team, you will experience:    An international work environment, in which you can develop your talent and realize ideas and innovations within a competent team   Your own career path within Sanofi. Your professional and personal development will be supported purposefully

column2: Job Location: Bangalore (Hosur Road)        Designation: Finished Goods (FG) Planner         Candidates from Pharma API companies highly preferred         Job Summary:   The planner works within the planning horizon and in conjunction with CMO operations and DC2 production teams to produce and execute a production plan. The objective is to achieve the desired customer service levels, desired inventory coverage and to facilitate optimum inventory turnover/cycle time.    Job Responsibilities:     Prepare a 6-month rolling supply plan for all markets and finalized supply/production, plan will be uploaded in SAP.  The Planner is a primary point of contact for all supply related issues throughout the life cycle of products.  Create and issue stock transport orders (STOs) for finished goods will supply from DC2, if required based on business process  Monitor inventory levels for finish goods (example blocked, short dated etc.) and take appropriate actions as required with the objective of achieving inventory targets with sufficient expiry dating in order to meet customer service requirements, ensure timely disposal of rejected and expired products.  Maintain and update all applicable dates within SAP to provide current available to promise (ATP) dates, at the appropriate plant. As required, inform all applicable internal parties within organization when date changes impacts internal & external customer service.  Maintain open & continuous communication with CMO operation team, DC2 production, quality team, regulatory, R&D, procurement, project management for new product launch, warehouse, and logistics team to support all relevant activities for product supply. Provide priority recommendations to CMO & DC2 team and escalate to management as required.  Perform all work in accordance with all established regulatory, compliance and safety requirements of the organization.      Interested candidates kindly send your resume to  naveenkumar@bvrpc.com

column2: This position focuses on working directly on inventing, developing and extending our internally developed API Gateway framework    Our mission is to meet Medtronic s Global Application Services software development needs as well as our DataOps needs for security, data integration and management   Our framework is built using primarily Software AG webMethods and secondarily Mulesoft ESB     There is some support for AWS API Gateway as well     Our API Gateway product is built for all teams across Medtronic to use and interoperate their application interfaces and data integration needs     We are in the early stages of developing a robust data mesh service for business data interoperability, security, and interoperability      A Day in the Life           Work closely with all team members on elements of the API Gateway and design, add, refactor, and improve capabilities for our stakeholders in either their application API needs, or in their ongoing data mesh integration needs       Participate in efforts to design, build, and develop rapid Proof-of-Concept (POC) solutions and services that quickly get added to our production service.   The rapid POC method has proven effective in enhancing our product in a rapidly evolving market.       Work closely with our global security and identity access team to constantly keep our interfaces, access, identity, tokens, secrets, and all other security access and design specifications up-to-date and secure       Work with our Site Reliability Engineering Team (SRE) and test team to develop production code that incorporates the need for programmatic operations and fully automated testing       Be comfortable, skilled, and excited to work closely with stakeholders and clients and create positive interactions and relationships to continue to drive the value of the platform higher for their business needs     Be an integral member of the core DevSecOps/Shared Services development team and help develop, test, deploy, and operate our services 24x7x365 globally        Must Have: Minimum Requirements      Doctorate degree OR Master s degree      OR      Bachelor s degree and 1-3 years of related experience      OR      Associate degree and 4-7 years of related experience      OR      High School Diploma and 7+ years of related experience    Nice to Have         A degree in computer science or related field      Experience as a full-stack software engineer shipping successful commercial products and/or services to customers using a SDLC process from start to finish      Product development experience designing, developing, deploying, and operating global products with expectation for 100% uptime service      Experience using one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: Java, C, C++, Swift/Objective C, Python, Go, C#, or JavaScript.      Experience in User Interface (UI) development using modern web technologies and patterns such as MVC/MVP/MVVM, REST, HTML/CSS and JavaScript/TypeScript      Working knowledge of data structures, algorithms, highly concurrent programming, and software design patterns with instrumentation for observability      Have a track record of being willing and able to learn new technologies at a rapid pace      Communication skills to work with client partners in articulating the vision of automation, DevSecOps, and DataOps.      Any experience or familiarity with FDA quality and validation processes is a plus

column2: Position Title: Senior Accounts Executive (Pharmaceuticals)Location: Vasai and Lower ParelPosition Summary:The Senior Accounts Executive in the pharmaceutical industry plays a vital role in managing financial transactions, reporting, and compliance within the organization. This position involves overseeing various accounting functions, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, financial reporting, and budgeting while ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements and company policies. Additionally, familiarity with SAP (Systems, Applications, and Products in Data Processing) is required to effectively manage financial data and processes within the SAP environment.Key Responsibilities:Manage day-to-day accounting operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, general ledger entries, and bank reconciliations, to ensure the accuracy and completeness of financial records.Prepare and review financial statements, reports, and analyses, including balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements, and variance analysis, to support decision-making and regulatory compliance.Coordinate and facilitate the month-end and year-end closing processes, ensuring timely and accurate completion of financial reporting tasks and reconciliations.Maintain and update accounting policies, procedures, and internal controls to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., GAAP, IFRS) and company policies.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Finance, Procurement, and Operations, to support financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting activities, and provide financial insights and recommendations.Monitor accounts receivable aging and collections activities, follow up on overdue accounts, and coordinate with sales and customer service teams to resolve billing issues and disputes.Manage vendor relationships, including invoice processing, payment approvals, and vendor inquiries, to ensure timely and accurate payment processing and maintain positive vendor relations.Perform periodic reviews and audits of financial transactions, accounts, and processes to identify discrepancies, risks, and opportunities for process improvement.Assist in the implementation and maintenance of SAP ERP systems, including configuration, data migration, user training, and system upgrades, to support efficient financial data management and reporting.Provide guidance, training, and support to junior accounting staff, ensuring their professional development and adherence to accounting standards and best practices.Qualifications and Skills:Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field required; CPA or relevant professional certification preferred.Minimum of 2 years of experience in accounting or finance roles within the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry, with a strong understanding of pharmaceutical accounting principles and regulatory requirements.Proficiency in SAP ERP systems, including SAP Financial Accounting (FI), Controlling (CO), and Materials Management (MM), with hands-on experience in SAP implementation, configuration, and user support.Solid knowledge of financial reporting standards (e.g., GAAP, IFRS) and regulatory compliance requirements applicable to the pharmaceutical industry.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret financial data, identify trends, and make data-driven recommendations.Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate financial information to non-finance stakeholders.Detail-oriented and organized, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other accounting software applications, with the ability to create complex spreadsheets, financial models, and analyses.
